story:
Get Your License FREE!

We've started a Referral Program. Now you have chance to get 3 enterprise cms installation license (multiple websites) for FREE! 

All you have to do is copy unique Link on the Now It's Simple Indiegogo page (it's right next to the video) and share with friends, colleagues and people, who create websites. 

If you refer 2 license contributions at any level, you will get  3 enterprise cms installation license, worth 40€, for FREE. 

Who else Needs the Custom Design and Features?

We decided to build “Now It’s Simple Content Manager” because we (and our clients) always want custom design elements and features, such as integrations of 3-rd party widgets, and external data sources. Of course, there are many cms systems out there but none of them has all this features:

  • provide full control over templates and controllers directly inside the administration area
  • is full-featured with nice editing (text, blocks, components)
  • has powerful Rest API
  • built entirely in JavaScript (NodeJS)


Web Development Re-imagined

Stop styling predefined widgets and components! Instead attach reusable behaviours to your design. Just take your HTML and setup content editors, controller, data bindings and parser in a few clicks.

Editing Content You'll Fall in Love With

Every content editor wants see the web page while editing it and have a full control over the widgets. Add a new page, set its design or write and publish a new blog post is a piece of cake. e.g. WYSIWYG is good for beginners. MARKDOWN is unbeatable when it comes to text writing and authoring. Technical support time will cut down to the minimum. Your clients will love you!


Most Effective Workflow (Designer-Coder-Editor)

Don't waste Your, Designer or Html Coder time on repeated content editing tasks. Draw the design or download the template, setup the widgets and let Content editors build the website structure and content. This will ensure you fastest website production.


Ultimate Marketing Tool

Now It’s Simple CMS was born out of frustration, when companies used web solely for the online presence forgetting its possibilities as the ultimate marketing tool.
Changes on pages are costly - both in time and money - but the future with “Now It’s Simple” is flexible and fast.

Want to find out something about page visitors? Use Forms!. Forms allow you to implement longer questioner on the web page. Use one question forms to get a higher response rate and merge answers by email address.

Create newsletters and autoresponders the same way as web pages. Template engine will replace properties inside brackets (e.g. [[name]]) by form, or customer data, after render.

Made by Web Developers for Web Developers and Designers

It is designed by web the developers just like you. We are in your shoes... Just remember how much time we have spent adjusting the design of a component. Now we can forget about it! Now It’s Simple Content Manager works with the process of the web development in mind. Widgets and their design are separated. You can reuse widgets, set their design for a new project, save and done!


Modern and Ultra Fast

It is a Node.js application powered by optimized Total.js framework. We appreciate MongoDB’s lighting fast speed. User Interface is written in AngularJS so can be very easy extended.

Now It’s Simple Content Manager templating is easy. All you need is a basic knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript for that little bit of dynamic functionality  and you are ready to go!

Use Any NodeJS Module!

You can use any module from NPM. Also compatible with express middlewares. 

Just require it in controllers, modules, etc. For more information see Total.js documentation.

Did We Mention It Is Simple?

Thanks to Total.js modularity, project structure keeps very nice.

Free and Enterprise editions

Now It's Simple Content Manager will be completely free. In the free version, you'll get full control over the templates and controllers directly in admin, ability to attach behaviour to your design, reuse widgets, etc. You won't get Enterprise CMS features described below.
Contribute to Open Souce
Most parts of our CMS are open source. See Total.js framework, Now It's Simple Github. If you are interested in Open Source Free edition of the CMS or have more questions, write us email hello@nowitsimple.com. 
SaaS
We play with an idea to provide CMS as a Service. We look forward to hearing from you. Send us short or long message :) hello@nowitssimple.com. 
Do You Have More Questions? Use same email hello@nowitssimple.com Thanks :)


Enterprise CMS

Now It's Simple Content Manager is a free Node.js CMS. Its enterprise version contains more useful features. 

  • Forms
  • Content editors roles, permissions and workflow
  • Content versioning
  • Member areas (define non-public areas on website, which are enabled only for registered members)
  • Dynamic routing templates
  • Full-text search - sync with Elastic


Stretch Goals 

Help us to unlock stretch goals and get more Node.js Enterprise Web Development Tools. If the goal is unlocked you'll get the license to Docker Manager, Ecommerce Manager automatically. Share and get more!

1. Manage Multiple CMS Instances

11 000€ -  unlock the Docker Manager

Docker Manager. Is the ultimate tool for management Docker instances. Build, start, kill container from the admin interface. What is and why developers like Docker.  

2. Missing Ecommerce?

28 000€ -  unlock the Ecommerce Manager


Ecommerce Manager. Want to build little Amazon? Then help us to unlock this stretch goal! Ecommerce Manager enables to import and convert Data, manages Workflows and has powerful API. You'll find more screenshots on our page. 


People behind Now It’s Simple

We are a team of three people, web developers, internet & coffee and life simplicity lovers.

Matus Szabo. I've been in software and internet business since 2008. First, I've been working as software analyst in the company One Click, following as an expert in online marketing, web analytics for an e-commerce company. I've been programming since 2009, first in.NET, but since 2012 I've switched to Node.js and utterly falling in love with it.

Tomas Holovsky. I've been in the online business since my graduation in 2006. I've been working in several online marketing positions for major czech and slovak online businesses. I met Matus in 2009 and since then we became close collaborators. First it was our the fashion online start-up. Then, we shifted focus on building B2B and B2C portals for several companies actively helping them succeed in the online business.

Peter Sirka. I've been programming aficionado since 2007. My whole life is turning around programming and code, working on projects for banks, financial corporations, web portals and more. I'm the creator of the world famous Node.js-based framework Total.js (If you find a bug, please report it to me ;). Thanks. Work is my hobby.


Help Us Bring this Product Alive

We have put a lot of hours into the development of “Now It’s Simple” Content Manager. We have tested its power and efficiency by successfully deploying it to a dozen of the web pages. The current version is quite stable, but still in alpha. 

While a lot of work has been already done  more lies ahead. With your support, we can focus to release a beta version of “Now It’s Simple” Content Manager. Our goal is clear and your kind pledges will help us:

  • Documentation & Tutorials - First we want to ship the comprehensive user documentation to you, describing all the system features. This will be done in two months.
  • Development -The Beta version is planned two-month development.

Pledge and gain Discount.

Share. Thank You!

story:
To celebrate the release of Neptune, the Coraxo debut album:

We'd love to offer you this design as a t-shirt to celebrate the holiday season and our first ever full length album release. Thing is, getting t-shirts printed is very expensive and we're currently swamped with our touring plans. So, we thought why not ask people to preorder the shirts?
We'll contact our supporters after the campaign has finished for your shirt sizes and options, there's no way to add sizes to the campaign itself.
We need 25 people to order the shirt so we can cover the costs of getting them done. As an advantage you'll get them very cheap if you preorder, plus we'll throw in some other shirts and CD's to sweeten the deal. Sounds good? Help us make it happen!
Remember to spread the word about our campaign to your friends, family and co-workers, it would be a great help.
Disclaimer: We will contact all backers individually for shirt sizes and other option from your perks after the campaign has finished! There's no way to add shirt size options to the campaign.

story:
Be a Founding Supporter of an up-and-coming brand that's bringing human-quality style to pets. Dogs and cats can look and feel their best in seamlessly accessorizing collars. And pet parents can show off their special bond with effortlessly unique "twinning" looks. 

Note: "Claimed Perks" is currently low due to no-longer-visible, already-claimed Early Bird Perks ;)

For dog (and cat) moms and dads who are totally obsessed with their furbabes, Joey Ro is an up and coming line of mix and match accessories that celebrates the special bond between pets and their people.

Our product line features premium materials for:

  • durability
  • safety
  • style

Patent-pending design

The Joey Ro product line begins with our signature collar. It features a novel design that is made to be accessorized with our rotating line of pet accessories.  This offers:

  • fun, easy accessorization
  • secure, comfortable wear
  • interchangeability 

Right now, we're offering them in the following sizes:

Small | 9.5- 13.5 in. neck circumference | Fits dogs and cats 5-20 lbs

Medium | 14-18 in. neck circumference | Fits dogs 20-60 lbs

Large | 17.5 -21.5 in. neck circumference | Fits dogs 60-80 lbs

Every pet accessory has a matching human counterpart, so that pets and their people can coordinate their style and show off their special bond.

Seasonal, thematic accessories for pets and their people

Our sample product line exhibits an array of pattern designs, but we will offer a much more expansive catalogue of prints that will be offered seasonally. When you pre-order our accessories, you'll be able to choose from a broad selection of prints. We will offer styles for:

  • Holidays
  • Pride
  • Culture icons
  • Everyday fun

With an initial offering of coordinating leather products:

  • Collars
  • Leashes
  • Keychains
  • Apple watchbands

We're also currently offering mix and match accessories across the following categories, but with exciting plans to expand:

  • Pet bandanas and bowties
  • Human bowties, hairbands, and scarves

 

The story

Nicole is the proud pet parent to Alfie, a rescue cockapoo with a heart of gold and head-turning good looks. Ever since adopting him, she's reveled in opportunities to gussy him up with cute accessories. Unfortunately some of them irritated his neck, fell apart, or didn't pair well with his collar. It was also impossible to find matching ensembles to show off their special bond together on Instagram or holiday cards. And thus Joey Ro was born.

With Alfie at the helm as CEO and Nicole supporting him as his faithful assistant, they've had a blast iterating on styles, materials, and construction until landing on products they're proud to offer the world.  

     

     

    Support us with your pre-order

    Your contribution will give us the funds we need to move our product line into production at scale. You'll benefit from getting a deep discount and first access, and we'll use your investment to cover some of the initial expenses of production. 

    We've prototyped, sourced, and tested our products, and we're excited to give you first dibs.

    • Your funds go directly to production costs
    • You get first access 
    • We'll love you forever <3 
    • If we don't meet our funding goal, you won't be charged (but we'll also walk away with our tails tucked between our legs)

       

       

      Giving back

      Joey Ro's CEO, Alfie, was roaming the mean streets of Austin until an amazing rescue organization got his tail wagging again. We want all animals to get the same chance to be cared for and loved, so we'll be donating a portion of all profits to a rotating list of animal welfare organizations around the world. In addition, we'll be bringing our accessories, photographers, and groomers on site to shelters to help needy dogs and cats find their forever homes.

      • Animal welfare support
      • Funds and action
      • Uniting pets with their people

       

       

      Thank you!

      Thanks for taking the time to learn more about Joey Ro. We can't wait to see you and your furbaby in your new duds.  

      As seen in:

Everyday fun


With an initial offering of coordinating leather products:

Collars
Leashes
Keychains
Apple watchbands


We're also currently offering mix and match accessories across the following categories, but with exciting plans to expand:

Pet bandanas and bowties
Human bowties, hairbands, and scarves

 

The story
Nicole is the proud pet parent to Alfie, a rescue cockapoo with a heart of gold and head-turning good looks. Ever since adopting him, she's reveled in opportunities to gussy him up with cute accessories. Unfortunately some of them irritated his neck, fell apart, or didn't pair well with his collar. It was also impossible to find matching ensembles to show off their special bond together on Instagram or holiday cards. And thus Joey Ro was born.
With Alfie at the helm as CEO and Nicole supporting him as his faithful assistant, they've had a blast iterating on styles, materials, and construction until landing on products they're proud to offer the world.  

 


 
Support us with your pre-order
Your contribution will give us the funds we need to move our product line into production at scale. You'll benefit from getting a deep discount and first access, and we'll use your investment to cover some of the initial expenses of production. 
We've prototyped, sourced, and tested our products, and we're excited to give you first dibs.

Your funds go directly to production costs
You get first access 
We'll love you forever <3 
If we don't meet our funding goal, you won't be charged (but we'll also walk away with our tails tucked between our legs)


 

 

Giving back
Joey Ro's CEO, Alfie, was roaming the mean streets of Austin until an amazing rescue organization got his tail wagging again. We want all animals to get the same chance to be cared for and loved, so we'll be donating a portion of all profits to a rotating list of animal welfare organizations around the world. In addition, we'll be bringing our accessories, photographers, and groomers on site to shelters to help needy dogs and cats find their forever homes.

Animal welfare support
Funds and action
Uniting pets with their people

 

 

Thank you!
Thanks for taking the time to learn more about Joey Ro. We can't wait to see you and your furbaby in your new duds.  
As seen in:

story:
SSDGM & End the Backlog

Murderinos! SSDGM is our bat signal. It's our secret identifier, our subtle anthem. 

KA ORA bracelets are beautiful, silver-plated brass, and made in New England with American parts. Each bracelet is hand-stamped and checked for quality. The coolest part? Any organization can create a design and, with a minimum order, create the tooling to make as many bracelets as we want. For now, we're taking pre-orders to create the tooling and then the bracelets will be for sale continuously afterward. The best part? Quarterly checks sent to End the Backlog in support of their mission.

How this works:

  • Put down your deposit for the first round of SSDGM bangle bracelet. Get one for your sister (you've shared the MFM with your sister, right?), your best friend, and that girl that you knew in college who is in that murderino group and now you realize was totally cool. Or, you know, spoil yourself.

*if we don't raise enough to get the bracelets made, you'll get your money back!

story:
The Most Bang For Your Buck

Jackets

At Threads of Apollo, we aim to offer  premium, leather jackets that rival most out there but also at a reasonable price.

1) It all starts with the leather. Each ToA jacket is made from premium full-grain sheepskin leather, to provide that soft, supple feel that you only find with expensive jackets. 

2) We have paired the leather up with two separate inner linings. Each ToA jacket has a 100% cotton lining for the body and separate inner sleeve linings made from 100% satin. 

3) Each ToA jacket will also be equipped with high-quality gunmetal or silver snap buttons as well as YKK zippers which are known for their resilience. 

4) These days, we understand individuals carry more on them than in the past. Unlike most leather jackets out there, each ToA jacket will have 5 inner utility pockets that individuals can use to keep their stuff in without compromising the look of the jacket. 

Gloves 

We wanted to provide something else that went well with our jackets. After thinking about it, we came to the conclusion that nothing goes better with jackets than a nice pair of gloves. 

Like our jackets, we wanted to provide the best possible gloves we could at a price that made sense.

1) Like our jackets, it all starts with the leather. Our gloves are made from premium top-grain sheepskin leather to match the feel of our jackets. 

2) Our gloves will not only help keep your hands warm, they will feel so good that you'll never want to take them off. Each ToA pair will have a 50% cashmere and 50% wool blend lining to ensure comfort. 

3) Let's face it, we are addicted to our devices. It would be a shame if you couldn't use them while wearing our gloves. Each ToA pair will have touch screen material on the index and thumbs so anyone wearing them will be able to use their device while keeping their hands warm and comfy. 

4) We wanted these gloves to be a part of our jackets....literally. Each ToA pair will have attachable snap buttons similar to a pair of inner snap buttons in each jacket so you can store your gloves and use them, wherever and whenever, without sacrificing any pocket space.

____________________________________________________________________________________

The Jackets & Gloves 

____________________________________________________________________________________

Achilles "Racer" Jacket

Achilles front with removable hood

Achilles back with removable hood

The Story

There is probably no warrior as great as Achilles. He was the deciding factor in the Trojan War. At times, Achilles was known for his all-consuming rage, which meant trouble for his enemies as well as the gods themselves. Achilles was not scared of anyone. His initial pursuit for greatness and glory was derailed by his thirst for vengeance against the man who killed his cousin. Although Achilles got his revenge, these chain of events eventually led to his death...an arrow through his only weak spot, his heel. We wanted our take on the racer leather jacket to be the most versatile of the three designs. A jacket that is ideal, but not limited to, a starter jacket. A straightforward style with a removable hood, this jacket can be dressed up or down. The threads that keep this jacket together are imbued with Achilles' essence. We all have weaknesses. Achilles was known for his heel; however, not accepting his own flaws was his ultimate downfall. Let this jacket be a reminder that, although we are all warriors in our own right, being self-aware of who you are as a person will allow you to reach your full potential.

Ares "Biker" Jacket

Ares front with removable belt

 

Ares back with removable belt

The Story

In Ancient Greek mythology, Ares was one of the twelve Olympians. He was known as the "God of War". Ares was the personification of the aspects of war that dealt with ruthlessness and aggression. He was hated by most gods due to his savage nature. So, why did we name a jacket after him? Despite all his faults, Ares did what he needed to do to be victorious. When you are dealing with negative feelings or a lack of self-confidence, sometimes, you need to be ruthless and do whatever it takes to ensure that the positive prevails over the negative. To do that, you need to feel powerful. We chose to associate Ares with our take on the iconic Biker jacket. With its minimal design and fearless look; the threads that keep this jacket together, are imbued with Ares' essence. So, the next time you feel negative or down, channel your inner Ares and deal with those emotions head-on and without mercy.

Icarus "Flight" Jacket

Icarus front with removable fur collar

Icarus back with removable fur collar

The Story

In Ancient Greece, Icarus was the son of the master craftsman Daedalus. After both were imprisoned, Daedalus created wings out of wax and feathers to escape. Daedalus flew first, but before he did, he warned Icarus not to fly too high because the sun would melt his wings; or too low because the sea's dampness would clog them. Icarus did not listen and his hubris got the best of him. He flew too high and his wings melted away. Icarus plunged to his death. He took a worthwhile risk when he decided to fly. A risk that would have paid off if he had only stayed the course. We think Icarus is the perfect namesake for our minimalist and modern take on the iconic flight jacket. Imbued with Icarus' essence, let this jacket represent level-headedness. Whenever you are facing a worthwhile risk, whether it is getting out of your comfort zone to speak to someone that you admire or starting a business; remember not to get too high when things are good or too low when they aren't. Stay the course and stay confident. Good things will come.

Additional Features

Utility pockets for the modern young adult male. They are conveniently located inside so they do not interfere with the look of the jacket. Each style of jacket will have these pockets

 

Everyone has different needs. We wanted these pockets to be different from each other so you can use them however you want

Hands of Apollo

Hands of Apollo - Come in black or brown colours (no unlock necessary). Touch screen material on thumb and index fingers

Hands of Apollo are able to attach to any ToA jacket through the use of snap buttons

 

The Story

Apollo was arguably the Greek God with the most talent. Whether it was creating the next great master piece, taking down his foes with his exceptional archery skills or healing individuals through medicine; Apollo's hands were gifted with many talent. An individual’s hands are vital when it comes to reaching their potential, so we decided the best accessory to start off with would be our take on leather gloves. Our modern design and the ability to attach them to any ToA jacket, makes our gloves an ideal item to go hand in hand with our jackets. Imbued with Apollo's skill, we want anyone who wears them to, not only protect their hands from the cold, but also serve as a reminder of your potential that you can unlock within yourself by using your hands. Unlike Apollo, we aren't Greek Gods, born with self- confidence. We need to get out of our comfort zone to grow. Everyone has some talent within them that is begging to be released. So, the next time you are holding your self back from accessing your talent, wear these gloves and feel Apollo’s confidence flowing through you. 

Our Motivation

It's Personal

At Threads of Apollo (ToA), we want you to look and feel good. By creating stories behind each product, we hope to spark positive feelings that drive good habits. Ultimately it is up to you to reach your full potential. Our goal is to help you get there in our own unique way.  

I was struggling with finding my way out of my own negative and sometimes paralyzing thoughts. The way I was thinking and my old habits just weren't working. I needed to change before it was too late. I decided to start with how I dressed. After getting some help from a friend as well as doing my own research online, I started to put together some simple outfits. The better I looked, the better I started feeling about myself. I later realized that I was using apparel to consistently associate the positive thoughts and habits I set out for myself. Overtime, things like starting a company, which felt impossible before, now felt doable. I wanted to share my experiences with as many individuals as possible. I was fortunate enough to have connections with a leather apparel manufacture overseas. I thought, what better way to help than with leather jackets. 

Nothing exudes confidence more than a leather jacket! Whether someone is new to fashion and wants a quality leather jacket to start off or whether someone is a seasoned veteran when it comes to fashion and is looking for a quality and modern piece to go with their style.  

After a year and a half of setting up the company, prototyping, changes and delays; I am ready to present this brand. We will start off my offering premium leather jackets and gloves at a price that is affordable for most young adults. I want this brand to be as unique as the individuals wearing the apparel. The only thing stopping me now is money. I used what I had to get this to where it is now. Kickstarter is where dreams come true. I hope that is the case for me too. I have the designs. I have the capability to make the jackets. I am determined to succeed. All I need now is your backing. 

The Designs

Based out of Vancouver, BC Canada, we set out to design three very different leather jackets that are different enough from each other to work with any style. By combining modern minimalist style with the seamless integration of utility pockets, we are proud to offer premium apparel from a brand made by a flawed young adult, for flawed young adults. It doesn't matter who you are, everyone deserves access to high-quality apparel that suits their style and that makes them feel more confident.

The Affordability

Being a young adult male myself and navigating life in one of the most expensive cities in the world; I am more than sympathetic when it comes to the deciding if it is worth spending half your paycheck on one apparel item. At Threads of Apollo, this is personal to us. It is our duty to let young adult males have access to high quality and fashionable jackets that most of us can afford. And if you don't mind spending big on apparel items; then the money you save on a Threads of Apollo jacket will come in handy when you are looking to buy that next big item. 

  • Crowdfunding allows us to maintain control of Threads of Apollo so we can pursue our vision of aiding young adult males the way we think is best.That includes not sacrificing quality, utility and style as well as operating the company in a more unique style which is different from traditional apparel companies.
     
  • We only order stock based on how many backers we receive allowing us to save on storage and logistics at the very beginning.
     
  • By getting rid of the middle man, using modern marketing tools like social media marketing & ads, not needing brick and motor stores and the overhead associated with them; we get to keep the price as low as possible without comprising the quality of the jackets and gloves.

 

Measurements 

  • Please note that these jackets are slim fit. For a looser/more regular fit, please size up.
  • These jackets are hand stitched. 90% of the time, the sizes will be correct. Humans aren't perfect though so please allow for a 0.25-0.5 inch error tolerance. 
  • Please note that these gloves are standard European sized. They are more slim fit then your typical US sized gloves.
  • These gloves are also hand stitched. 90% of the time, the sizes will be correct. People make mistakes though so please allow for a 0.1-0.2 inch error tolerance.

Timeline

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Be handy!

If you suddenly meet someone you want to talk to, where do you keep your Airpods? In your palm? in your pocket? In your bag? You must feel a little bit uncomfortable about possibly losing your AirPods. Solve the problem by using the A-Strap! The A-Strap allows you to just hang your valuable AirPods around your neck And you can freely use both hands without fearing you might drop or lose your AirPods.

Just imagine, you arrive at office, do you keep Airpods back in the charging case? No need! Just hang your Airpods around your neck! Your do not need to open your Airpod case and close it again, again and again. You can use Airpods easily and quickly on-the-go and whenever you need them.

 

Be Charmed!

Even though the A-Strap is meant to help you from losing your AirPods, , if it does not look good, you will not use it. Appearance is very important. We had carefully chosen the materials and ensured that they are processed to meet the high expectations from AirPods users.

  • Material Production: We adopted the same material processing method adopted for the MacBook and iPhone, called CNC milling. We applied sand-blasting and anodizing as finishing touches. These give the A-Strap the elegant look customers look for in a quality product.

  • PU artificial leather mesh: We identified PU artificial leather mesh to be the best material for the A-Strap. They do not get dirty easily and are easy to clean. They provide the proper tension and users can wear the A-Strap comfortably. There are a whole range of colors available. Airpods users can choose which colors to match their unique taste.

 

Be Unique!

We surveyed AirPods users to find out what designs they want in AirPods straps. There were too many answers! There is no one solution, and everyone wants something unique they can call their own. Our solution is to give customers a chance to design and make their own! So, we present to you the A-Strap, a DIY kit. Assembly way is very simple.

Most customers are happy with our basic A-strap. But they can change the designs and make their AirPod straps unique if they want to. Try it yourself!

 

Be Safe!

When designing the A-Strap, we wanted the A-Strap to not only keep AirPods safe through tight and secure attachments, but also to be easy for users to set and remove the AirPods into and from the A-Strap. To achieve this balance, , we designed the A-Strap to incorporate two functional layers.

1.       Aluminum outer layer: The aluminium prevents the inner layer from being over-extended. Other AirPods straps are easily over-extended and, often, users lose their AirPods easily.

2.       Silicon inner layer: The silicon makes the A-Strap easy to set and remove. With silicon friction, A-Strap can hold AirPods firmly. 

3.       Special space: AirPods have size variability between 0.3mm to 0.7mm. Our design has taken this into consideration and ensured that this variability can easily be matched by our A-Straps.

With these design consideration, customers can enjoy AirPods in the comfort of knowing that they are safely secured in the A-Strap.

 

Risk and challenges

We are dedicated to setting our product standards high, and we will do our absolutely best to fulfill deliveries to you, our  backers!

We have passed our prototype and testing stage successfully. We have prepared factories which have many experience and good facilities for you.

However, shipping a large number of products at once can be challenging considering we have a small team. Early birds will be delivered first, following with other Indigogo orders.

We understand unexpected situation might occur, and we promise to keep our backers updated at all times.

If you suddenly meet someone you want to talk to, where do you keep your Airpods? In your palm? in your pocket? In your bag? You must feel a little bit uncomfortable about possibly losing your AirPods. Solve the problem by using the A-Strap! The A-Strap allows you to just hang your valuable AirPods around your neck And you can freely use both hands without fearing you might drop or lose your AirPods.

Just imagine, you arrive at office, do you keep Airpods back in the charging case? No need! Just hang your Airpods around your neck! Your do not need to open your Airpod case and close it again, again and again. You can use Airpods easily and quickly on-the-go and whenever you need them.
 
Be Charmed!
Even though the A-Strap is meant to help you from losing your AirPods, , if it does not look good, you will not use it. Appearance is very important. We had carefully chosen the materials and ensured that they are processed to meet the high expectations from AirPods users.

Material Production: We adopted the same material processing method adopted for the MacBook and iPhone, called CNC milling. We applied sand-blasting and anodizing as finishing touches. These give the A-Strap the elegant look customers look for in a quality product.

PU artificial leather mesh: We identified PU artificial leather mesh to be the best material for the A-Strap. They do not get dirty easily and are easy to clean. They provide the proper tension and users can wear the A-Strap comfortably. There are a whole range of colors available. Airpods users can choose which colors to match their unique taste.


 
Be Unique!
We surveyed AirPods users to find out what designs they want in AirPods straps. There were too many answers! There is no one solution, and everyone wants something unique they can call their own. Our solution is to give customers a chance to design and make their own! So, we present to you the A-Strap, a DIY kit. Assembly way is very simple.

Most customers are happy with our basic A-strap. But they can change the designs and make their AirPod straps unique if they want to. Try it yourself!
 
Be Safe!
When designing the A-Strap, we wanted the A-Strap to not only keep AirPods safe through tight and secure attachments, but also to be easy for users to set and remove the AirPods into and from the A-Strap. To achieve this balance, , we designed the A-Strap to incorporate two functional layers.

1.       Aluminum outer layer: The aluminium prevents the inner layer from being over-extended. Other AirPods straps are easily over-extended and, often, users lose their AirPods easily.
2.       Silicon inner layer: The silicon makes the A-Strap easy to set and remove. With silicon friction, A-Strap can hold AirPods firmly. 
3.       Special space: AirPods have size variability between 0.3mm to 0.7mm. Our design has taken this into consideration and ensured that this variability can easily be matched by our A-Straps.
With these design consideration, customers can enjoy AirPods in the comfort of knowing that they are safely secured in the A-Strap.


 







Risk and challenges
We are dedicated to setting our product standards high, and we will do our absolutely best to fulfill deliveries to you, our  backers!
We have passed our prototype and testing stage successfully. We have prepared factories which have many experience and good facilities for you.
However, shipping a large number of products at once can be challenging considering we have a small team. Early birds will be delivered first, following with other Indigogo orders.
We understand unexpected situation might occur, and we promise to keep our backers updated at all times.

story:
What is the meaning of R-HEA?

 The brand name means "R (Relationship) and HEA (Human Equal Animal)".

 It contains love for fashion and animals. More specifically, the value of life is precious to both humans and animals. Our brand has started with this belief.

 Today, more and more people are adopting animals. Animals have been our friends and family for a long time. But sadly many animals are being abandoned by their family and are dying. We have been struggling to make a meaningful brand for a long time. And finally, we start this project. In addition to making you more fashionable and trendy, we will also give abandoned animals hope.

 

  

 

 

 

 

 

Clothes Quality

We used 100% cotton. 100% Cotton is not chemical fiber, so it is recommended for sensitive skin such as allergy and atopy. Also, the shape of the clothes is well maintained and durable compared to other fabrics. So it is suitable for use in autumn and winter and can give the wearer a soft, warm feel.
 We also only use high-quality fabrics that have undergone "Dumbbell Washing" and "Tentering". After the dumbbell washing process, you can see the effects of calmness, soft touch , and low shrinkage. Furthermore, It is possible to maintain the fit of the clothes for a long time by increasing the durability of the clothes after the Tentering process. So you can avoid shrinkage and deformation of your clothes as much as possible.

 

 

Actual Situation

 Approximately 6.5 million companion animals enter U.S. animal shelters nationwide every year. Of those, approximately 3.3 million are dogs and 3.2 million are cats. This is only a figure in the United States. More and more people adopt animals, but there are animals abandoned. It can be inferred that the unofficial figures of abandoned animals would be much higher. Too many animals are dying alone. We have a plan to support the animals that have lost their families. That's why we have emphasized the meaning of "HEA" in our brand.

 

 

Future Plans

 We will continue to grow our brand. But not just end it, We aim to save animals that can not be thrown away or helped as part of our proceeds. In our first project, we will donate 50% of our proceeds. Donations are not limited to one country but will be used in various animal care facilities around the world. Also, feed donations, emergency surgery funding, and volunteer activities to help shelters are part of the plan.

 This support plan is not just a one-off event, but it will continue as long as our brand exists. Our specific activities will be continuously updated via SNS such as Facebook and Instagram.
 

 

R-HEA Team

 It has been over a year since we prepared this project. we wanted to express my passion for fashion and love for animals in clothes. To be honest, the process was never easy, but we were able to make the best quality clothes. We were very grateful to all the people who have made it possible for us to get here. We will always do our best.

Through our SNS, you can see a variety of donation activities and support through our proceeds. You can visit and communicate freely at any time.

Join us in the RHEA project and make it a reality by backing us. We've got everything ready for the mass production process and we only need you help to make it a reality and bring it to everyone.

 

Backing this project apart from buying clothes is a great strength for abandoned animals.

 

 

 

SNS

Instagram:  https://www.instagram.com/r_hea_official/

 

*After funding is completed, we will email you the shipping information you ordered*

*It will be shipped from our factory in Korea*

story:
Rake less!  Live more!  Direct-Bag-It!

How much time do you spend raking leaves each fall?

In 2005 we moved to a tree filled suburban St. Louis neighborhood.  The shade is great and the trees are beautiful, but come fall the yard hands down its decree of punishment: sentenced to 70+ yard bags of hard labor. 

Like many suburban home owners across the country, we dispose of our yard waste using the ubiquitous brown paper yard bag, as that is what our city accepts.  Filling these boogers is a labor intensive, annoying, time consuming chore.  I realized that I was spending most of my fall weekends dealing with our leafy bounty.  I hated raking and filling those bags—so much bending down, picking up, and repetitive tamping trying to get the most leaves into every bag.  Mowing wasn't much better.  My grass-catcher turned leaf-catcher completely filled after about 20 yards and I would have to dump it 4 - 5 times to fill a yard bag—spilling and making a mess in the process.  I knew there had to be a better way: I wanted my mower to fill directly into a yard bag.

Becoming Direct-Bag-It: the smart way to bag your yard

An ill-fated prototype was thrown together in 2006.  It took less than one trip around the outer loop of my back yard to decide I had created an example of what not to do.  But, in prototyping, learning what not to do is half the battle.  The goal was shelved for several years while growing the family, but in 2009 I revisited the idea during some course work.  Steady progress toward a different prototype culminated in an 11 December 2011 test that got this ball rolling. 

This thing really worked, saved time, and saved me effort.  Since that day I have spent just about all of my free time and a good chunk of change getting Direct-Bag-It patented and refining the design to the improved multi-season configuration you saw of alpha prototype in the video and in the beta prototype CAD renderings.  Now my goal is to get the same time and effort savings into your hands this fall!  Look below to see why Direct-Bag-It is the multi-season answer for your yard!

To ensure high quality and mangage costs, Direct-Bag-It is sold as a complete system: a modifed base mower with the bagging attachments.

Please see FAQ below for more information.

Help Me Help You

Direct-Bag-It will help YOU (and not just in the fall, see above and FAQ).  But I need help from you and all of your leaf-burdened friends to get the Direct-Bag-It beta prototype in the hands of early adopter customers.  You see, this is a manufacturing project, which is kind of old-school in these days of apps and web-tech startups.  Volume is everything in manufacturing, and I need to drum up sales for at least 40 of these puppies to get the production costs low enough to extend to you a reasonable purchase price in the mid-hundreds.  And, to even make that price possible, there is a good bit of fabrication I need to do.  I need help from everyone who has ever loathed raking and bagging their yard to contribute so I can buy equipment (see FAQ) and set up shop for the parts it didn't make sense to outsource. 

As tokens of my sincere appreciation in helping with this effort, I have a variety of perks available to commemorate your pledge toward the quest of defeating excess yard work.  This is an all-or-nothing, fixed funding campaign…if I don't meet my goal, I can't pull this off.  Please help make it happen!

This is a Chapter, Not the Book

Your help will prove there is a market for Direct-Bag-It and jumpstart subsequent production and design improvements.  I will work it as long as it is profitable or until one of the big players realizes this is the way leaves and grass clippings should be bagged and licenses my patent. 

If financially successful with this, I intend for it to benefit my family of course, but it will also do its small part to help our country.  As I said before, this is manufacturing, and manufacturing creates jobs up and down the supply chain more than just about any other industry.  I like that and you should too.  I pledge to keep work on this in the United States, and whenever possible source parts domestically.  If I do license to a big player, I will have them pledge the same.

There are many other engineering and design challenges I hope to eventually pursue through my company Top-Down Engineering LLC.  Direct-Bag-It is the focus for now since it solves so much and has strong potential.  Creating a revenue stream from this will allow me to apply myself to even more challenging pursuits at the intersection of energy, resource scarcity, and climate change (yes, I have ideas).  This is the first step.  Please help me take it!

 

Direct-Bag-It:  benefits, how-to, and specs

Benefits:

  • At least a twofold time reduction relative to conventional raking and bagging. (preliminary testing)
  • At least a twofold reduction in yard bag usage relative to raking and tamping. (preliminary testing)
  • A decreased overall effort relative to raking and bagging.
  • A yard with the leaves removed and the grass mowed simultaneously.
  • A leaf bagging system that is adaptable for optimum use in the fall as well as other seasons using the grass bagging and mulching modes.
  • The satisfaction of buying a multi-season, efficiency enhancing system that costs significantly less than a yard vacuum (that does not fill directly into yard bags, takes up extra space in your garage, and will only be used a few months out of the year).

How-to:

The base of the fill chute contains a plastic band which is compressed to the inside of the yard bag.  When released, it expands and seals to the yard bag.  Once connected, both are loaded into the bag holder.  The top of the fill chute has a draw string that cinches to the inlet adapter.  That's it!  Pull the mower starter cord, push the system, and directly fill that yard bag!

The fill chute is the key component to the patent pending Direct-Bag-It system.  It vents the discharge air and allows for overfill—enabling you to bag longer and achieve the ultimate in yard bagging efficiency: the single tamp. 

Once the bag and fill chute are full, un-cinch the top of the fill chute and remove together.  Settle the bag and then use the fill chute to tamp the overfill.  Remove the fill chute and there you have it: a directly filled, fully filled, cleanly filled, single tamp yard bag.

Specs:

  • Base mower (domestically built)
    • Honda GCV 160 motor, Husqvarna steel deck, large diameter ball bearing wheels
    • Push mower (not self propelled, maybe in the future!)
  • Direct-Bag-It
    • Structure: Fabricated steel; 12 and 16 gauge A36 hot-rolled steel, laser cut, e-coated for corrosion resistance.
    • Fill Chute: Cotton/poly fabric, plastic band, draw string; washable
    • Transfer: PVC piping, thermoplastic polyurethane tubing
    • Bag Holder Panels: Removable corrugated plastic
  • Weight
    • Approximate 15lb net increase over original mower in leaf and grass bagging modes (future area for improvement, although it is not difficult given the large diameter ball-bearing wheels)
    • Approximate 3lb net increase over original mower in mulch or side discharge mode

 

Campaign Perks

Here's how this works:  Find a perk you like, that fits your desired level of contribution (or better yet, buy the Direct-Bag-It system!).  If I don't meet my goal, you get your money back.  If the goal is met, all-systems-go!

 

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

Q: Is Direct-Bag-It the complete system, mower and attachments, or just the attachments?

A: Currently, Direct-Bag-It is the complete system, mower and attachments.

 

Q: Why can't I just buy the attachments and use them on the mower I have?

A:  The physical variations from mower to mower make it difficult to design parts that work across platforms.  Unique parts take extra design time and are expensive to manufacture in low volumes.  Note that the base mower for Direct-Bag-It is turned 180 degrees -- the rear discharge is now in the front, wheels have been swapped, the handle has been re-mounted, startup pull-cord is re-managed, motor and blade provide sufficient flow, etc.  As much as I would have liked to have created a universal attachment version of Direct-Bag-It, it is not feasible at this stage.  My approach has been to start with a high quality, light-weight, steel deck mower to produce something I know that works so that customers have a consistent positive user experience.  Direct-Bag-It will replace your mower as a year-round, multi-season, time and effort saving system...you can put that old mower on craigslist!

 

Q: How do I know if Direct-Bag-It is right for me?

A: If you rake and bag your leaves multiple times in the fall and push mow your lawn during spring and summer, you should definitely consider Direct-Bag-It.  If the thought of buying a lawn vacuum to manage your leaf load has ever crossed your mind, you should absolutely consider Direct-Bag-It. 

 

Q: A lawn mower has enough umph to lift the leaves and grass clippings into a yard bag?

A: I was surprised too!  The flow from the mower is actually quite remarkable.  My first prototype included an auxiliary blower, but I found it was not necessary.  Shows the importance of prototypes.

 

Q: What do you mean by beta prototype?

A: You should expect this product to work well, save you time, and save you effort.  However Direct-Bag-It is in an intermediate stage of design refinement.  Whereas a final commercial product would use injection-molded plastic components, this beta prototype still has some PVC pipe.  Whereas a final commercial product would be adjustable using hand levers, pins, and knobs, this beta prototype requires you to break out the socket set and turn a wrench.  That is basically what I mean...it still has some hardware store type components, may require a bit more hands-on thinking from you, but it will still perform the task effectively and efficiently.  

 

Q: What was the alpha prototype?

A: You saw the alpha prototype in the video and other pictures.  It is made of painted wood!  It is still tough to beat wood, screws, and bolts for time- and cost-effective prototyping.  The system works great actually, but is not suited for manufacturing.  As discussed in the specs section, the system you will receive is made from fabricated steel, a more manufacturable, respectable material for valued customers.

 

Q: What do you mean about being multi-season?

A:

Fall:  As you saw in the video, Direct-Bag-It was specially made to help you in the fall—significantly reducing your raking, piling, lifting, excessive tamping, leaf bagging time.  

Spring and Early Summer:   Direct-Bag-It is still advantageous for mowing grass in the spring and early summer, however, a modification to the bag is suggested.   It makes sense to use a right-sized, shortened yard bag (achieved by cutting off the top 1/3) to make the filled bag more manageable.  Grass clippings are much heavier than leaves, and a yard bag completely filled with grass would weigh something like 60 lbs.  When filled, the shortened bag weights a more manageable 25 lbs…about all you would want to push or lift to carry to the curb.  The inlet adapter arm is adjustable and a different inlet adapter is used to smooth the angle of the transfer tube.

Summer:  During the summer when the grass is less robust, bagging doesn't even make sense.  It is better to change to mulching mode to shed some extra weight.  During this time, the bag holder and transfer assembly are removable and a mulch plate can be installed.

When My Yard Has Been Neglected:  Say there is a situation where the grass is way overgrown and bagging or mulching won't even work.   You've just got to hack through it.  In that case, the side discharge of the original mower is still available.  Once the clippings dry, maybe you can bag them.

 

Q: Can I see around Direct-Bag-It?

A: In the fall, when the full sized bag is used, line-of-sight is reduced but not completely obscured.  This was the crux of latest design configuration.  If I was not satisfied with the line-of-sight, I would not use it.  You will still be able to see the line you are tracking, but may look to the side more often than with a typical mower.  The trade-off is worth it for the time and effort saved versus raking, trust me.  During spring and early summer, with the shortened bag, line-of-sight is practically the same as with a regular mower.  Again, achieving acceptable line-of-sight was required for me to use the system myself.

 

Q: Will all the leaves be picked up on the first pass?

A: No, not completely.  There will be some fragments that get left behind as mulch.  But then again, think about the performance of your raking or conventional mowing...I am guessing some gets left behind.  The difference with Direct-Bag-It is that the process overall takes so much less time and effort.  By general observation, I would say 75-85% of the leaves are bagged on the first pass.  The bulk of the leaves are collected and there will be a clear line of where you have been.  If desired, a reverse or second pass probably gets you into the +95% range.  Bagging the leaves in a counter-clockwise loop makes a big difference as excess typically flows to the left side of the system.  The concentric loops serve to corral the leaves to their eventual doom.  The same loop-wise method is not necessary while mowing during grass seasons.

 

Q: Will Direct-Bag-It vacuum my sidewalk and driveway?

A: Not exactly.  One my discoveries while using the system was that good grass helps to form a seal between the mower deck and the ground.  Without grass to perform that function, leaves and debris on hard surfaces tend to swirl out from underneath the deck leading to incomplete collection.  Deck height can be adjusted some to alleviate this, but generally your best bet is to move the debris to the lawn to bag it from there.

 

Q: Does Direct-Bag-It clog?

A: It can, but fortunately the transfer tube is easy to clear.  The main culprit is pushing too quickly over dense leaves or grass.  Under normal conditions you can push Direct-Bag-It just as fast as a regular mower, however, just like you would slow down with a regular mower in thick areas, you’ll need to do the same with Direct-Bag-It.  Sticks can also start a clog, so a stick pickup prior to mowing is a good idea.  Again, something that usually makes sense to do anytime you mow.

 

Q: Does the fill chute ever disconnect from the bag?

A: It can, but fortunately the fill chute plastic band is adjustable to minimize this occurrence.  A tight seal is important for keeping the fill chute connected.  I have noticed that from lot-to-lot, bag sizes do change enough to affect the seal.  So, if it is too loose, I expand the ring out.  If it is too tight (worse case, torn bag), I adjust the ring in.  I think outdoor temperature can have an effect as well requiring some adjustment, but I am still evaluating that.

 

Q: Is Direct-Bag-It Safe?

A: Insofar as lawn mowers are safe, Direct-Bag-It is safe.  All of the risks traditionally associated with rotary push mowers are present.  Additional considerations include clearing clogs and disconnect of the fill chute from the yard bag while bagging.  If you need to clear a clog from the discharge adapter, the spark plug wire should be disconnected to prevent accidental operation of the motor.  If the fill chute disconnects from the yard bag, immediately release the mower safety handle, causing the engine to stop.  Operators should wear personal protective equpment for eye sight and hearing.

 

Q: How will you provide support and what are the terms of sale?

A: My expectation is that as an early adopter of a beta prototype Direct-Bag-It, you will provide me feedback I can use to continually improve the system.  I want the good and the bad, the latter of which I hope is few and far between.  I don't really know how this will evolve with multiple systems "out in the wild," but I can assure you that I want you to be happy with the system.   I will try to make reasonable accommodations for any issue you may encounter and handle each on a case-by-case basis.  I am still working with legal to draft specific terms of sale, but generally I plan to provide a 30-day money-back guarantee.

 

Q: What do you need and why?

A: I basically need to set up shop for some light fabrication, assembly, packaging, and shipping of the system; yes, in my garage.  Hopefully this will be another "started in the garage" business success story.

 

Band Saw – This will allow me to cut the discharge adapter pipe and bag holder panels.

  • $545      Grizzly 14in
  • $79        shipping
  • $65        roller base
  • $0          shipping
  • $13        band saw book
  • $0          shipping

 

Drill Press – I need this so that I can drill holes in the inlet adapter and bag holder panels.

  • $120      Skil 10in
  • $0         free shipping

 

Work Table – I will need a large, sturdy work surface.

  • $290      72 x 36 Ash top
  • $125      shipping

 

Dust Collection –This will collect the dust from my power tools.

  • $175      Wall mount, light duty
  • $36        4" dia x 20' Hose
  • $20        shipping

 

Video Camera – Why write and print a manual when I can create how-to videos online?  This camera will help me create the user guide as well as aide in testing and diagnostics.

  • $400      Hero Go Pro 3 Black
  • $0          shipping
  • $100      accessories
  • $0          shipping

 

Tools, bits, bins, misc – This is my catchall for things I will likely need.

  • $1,000   Tools, bits, misc

 

Professional Services – Because it's what you're supposed to do when starting a business

  • $5000    Legal, accounting, and insurance

 

Total:  $7468   

The remainder of the funding is applied toward material costs, perks, campaign fees, and hopefully if things go well a modest profit to fund future development.

 

Project Risks and Challenges

I am sure there are expected and unexpeded are challenges lurking.  I have already overcome many to get this far, so I am confident I can overcome any that are ahead.

With anything that is manufactured, parts avaialability and delivery timeline can cause issues.  I have contacted suppliers of key components to let them know the level of orders that may occur.  That said, until you really submit that PO, it's hard to know whether what you need will arrive on time and at the budgeted cost.  Rest assured, if supply chain issues are detected, I will communicate those to you with an estimate of impact to delivery date.

I am just at the point of receiving test-fit parts for assembly of the beta-prototype of Direct-Bag-It.  There is some risk that parts will not assemble or operate as I expect, however, I should have time to resolve those prior purchasing for these orders.

Weather is a concern for my hands-on demonstration perks.  If we have a very wet fall it may be difficult to schedule and make all the rounds.

 

Last But Not Least

Thank you to my family, friends, and professional partners for helping this product get to this stage!  I am sure I will continue to lean on you as this moves forward.   Let's make it happen!

And, Thank You! for considering my campaign.  If you have any questions or comments, I can be reached at andrew@topdownengineering.com

Please see FAQ below for more information.





Help Me Help You
Direct-Bag-It will help YOU (and not just in the fall, see above and FAQ).  But I need help from you and all of your leaf-burdened friends to get the Direct-Bag-It beta prototype in the hands of early adopter customers.  You see, this is a manufacturing project, which is kind of old-school in these days of apps and web-tech startups.  Volume is everything in manufacturing, and I need to drum up sales for at least 40 of these puppies to get the production costs low enough to extend to you a reasonable purchase price in the mid-hundreds.  And, to even make that price possible, there is a good bit of fabrication I need to do.  I need help from everyone who has ever loathed raking and bagging their yard to contribute so I can buy equipment (see FAQ) and set up shop for the parts it didn't make sense to outsource. 
As tokens of my sincere appreciation in helping with this effort, I have a variety of perks available to commemorate your pledge toward the quest of defeating excess yard work.  This is an all-or-nothing, fixed funding campaign…if I don't meet my goal, I can't pull this off.  Please help make it happen!
This is a Chapter, Not the Book
Your help will prove there is a market for Direct-Bag-It and jumpstart subsequent production and design improvements.  I will work it as long as it is profitable or until one of the big players realizes this is the way leaves and grass clippings should be bagged and licenses my patent. 
If financially successful with this, I intend for it to benefit my family of course, but it will also do its small part to help our country.  As I said before, this is manufacturing, and manufacturing creates jobs up and down the supply chain more than just about any other industry.  I like that and you should too.  I pledge to keep work on this in the United States, and whenever possible source parts domestically.  If I do license to a big player, I will have them pledge the same.
There are many other engineering and design challenges I hope to eventually pursue through my company Top-Down Engineering LLC.  Direct-Bag-It is the focus for now since it solves so much and has strong potential.  Creating a revenue stream from this will allow me to apply myself to even more challenging pursuits at the intersection of energy, resource scarcity, and climate change (yes, I have ideas).  This is the first step.  Please help me take it!
 
Direct-Bag-It:  benefits, how-to, and specs
Benefits:


At least a twofold time reduction relative to conventional raking and bagging. (preliminary testing)

At least a twofold reduction in yard bag usage relative to raking and tamping. (preliminary testing)
A decreased overall effort relative to raking and bagging.
A yard with the leaves removed and the grass mowed simultaneously.
A leaf bagging system that is adaptable for optimum use in the fall as well as other seasons using the grass bagging and mulching modes.
The satisfaction of buying a multi-season, efficiency enhancing system that costs significantly less than a yard vacuum (that does not fill directly into yard bags, takes up extra space in your garage, and will only be used a few months out of the year).
How-to:
The base of the fill chute contains a plastic band which is compressed to the inside of the yard bag.  When released, it expands and seals to the yard bag.  Once connected, both are loaded into the bag holder.  The top of the fill chute has a draw string that cinches to the inlet adapter.  That's it!  Pull the mower starter cord, push the system, and directly fill that yard bag!
The fill chute is the key component to the patent pending Direct-Bag-It system.  It vents the discharge air and allows for overfill—enabling you to bag longer and achieve the ultimate in yard bagging efficiency: the single tamp. 
Once the bag and fill chute are full, un-cinch the top of the fill chute and remove together.  Settle the bag and then use the fill chute to tamp the overfill.  Remove the fill chute and there you have it: a directly filled, fully filled, cleanly filled, single tamp yard bag.
Specs:

Base mower (domestically built)

Honda GCV 160 motor, Husqvarna steel deck, large diameter ball bearing wheels
Push mower (not self propelled, maybe in the future!)

Direct-Bag-It

Structure: Fabricated steel; 12 and 16 gauge A36 hot-rolled steel, laser cut, e-coated for corrosion resistance.
Fill Chute: Cotton/poly fabric, plastic band, draw string; washable
Transfer: PVC piping, thermoplastic polyurethane tubing
Bag Holder Panels: Removable corrugated plastic

Weight

Approximate 15lb net increase over original mower in leaf and grass bagging modes (future area for improvement, although it is not difficult given the large diameter ball-bearing wheels)
Approximate 3lb net increase over original mower in mulch or side discharge mode


 
Campaign Perks
Here's how this works:  Find a perk you like, that fits your desired level of contribution (or better yet, buy the Direct-Bag-It system!).  If I don't meet my goal, you get your money back.  If the goal is met, all-systems-go!

 
Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
Q: Is Direct-Bag-It the complete system, mower and attachments, or just the attachments?
A: Currently, Direct-Bag-It is the complete system, mower and attachments.
 
Q: Why can't I just buy the attachments and use them on the mower I have?
A:  The physical variations from mower to mower make it difficult to design parts that work across platforms.  Unique parts take extra design time and are expensive to manufacture in low volumes.  Note that the base mower for Direct-Bag-It is turned 180 degrees -- the rear discharge is now in the front, wheels have been swapped, the handle has been re-mounted, startup pull-cord is re-managed, motor and blade provide sufficient flow, etc.  As much as I would have liked to have created a universal attachment version of Direct-Bag-It, it is not feasible at this stage.  My approach has been to start with a high quality, light-weight, steel deck mower to produce something I know that works so that customers have a consistent positive user experience.  Direct-Bag-It will replace your mower as a year-round, multi-season, time and effort saving system...you can put that old mower on craigslist!
 
Q: How do I know if Direct-Bag-It is right for me?
A: If you rake and bag your leaves multiple times in the fall and push mow your lawn during spring and summer, you should definitely consider Direct-Bag-It.  If the thought of buying a lawn vacuum to manage your leaf load has ever crossed your mind, you should absolutely consider Direct-Bag-It. 
 
Q: A lawn mower has enough umph to lift the leaves and grass clippings into a yard bag?
A: I was surprised too!  The flow from the mower is actually quite remarkable.  My first prototype included an auxiliary blower, but I found it was not necessary.  Shows the importance of prototypes.
 
Q: What do you mean by beta prototype?
A: You should expect this product to work well, save you time, and save you effort.  However Direct-Bag-It is in an intermediate stage of design refinement.  Whereas a final commercial product would use injection-molded plastic components, this beta prototype still has some PVC pipe.  Whereas a final commercial product would be adjustable using hand levers, pins, and knobs, this beta prototype requires you to break out the socket set and turn a wrench.  That is basically what I mean...it still has some hardware store type components, may require a bit more hands-on thinking from you, but it will still perform the task effectively and efficiently.  
 
Q: What was the alpha prototype?
A: You saw the alpha prototype in the video and other pictures.  It is made of painted wood!  It is still tough to beat wood, screws, and bolts for time- and cost-effective prototyping.  The system works great actually, but is not suited for manufacturing.  As discussed in the specs section, the system you will receive is made from fabricated steel, a more manufacturable, respectable material for valued customers.
 
Q: What do you mean about being multi-season?
A:
Fall:  As you saw in the video, Direct-Bag-It was specially made to help you in the fall—significantly reducing your raking, piling, lifting, excessive tamping, leaf bagging time.  
Spring and Early Summer:   Direct-Bag-It is still advantageous for mowing grass in the spring and early summer, however, a modification to the bag is suggested.   It makes sense to use a right-sized, shortened yard bag (achieved by cutting off the top 1/3) to make the filled bag more manageable.  Grass clippings are much heavier than leaves, and a yard bag completely filled with grass would weigh something like 60 lbs.  When filled, the shortened bag weights a more manageable 25 lbs…about all you would want to push or lift to carry to the curb.  The inlet adapter arm is adjustable and a different inlet adapter is used to smooth the angle of the transfer tube.
Summer:  During the summer when the grass is less robust, bagging doesn't even make sense.  It is better to change to mulching mode to shed some extra weight.  During this time, the bag holder and transfer assembly are removable and a mulch plate can be installed.
When My Yard Has Been Neglected:  Say there is a situation where the grass is way overgrown and bagging or mulching won't even work.   You've just got to hack through it.  In that case, the side discharge of the original mower is still available.  Once the clippings dry, maybe you can bag them.
 
Q: Can I see around Direct-Bag-It?
A: In the fall, when the full sized bag is used, line-of-sight is reduced but not completely obscured.  This was the crux of latest design configuration.  If I was not satisfied with the line-of-sight, I would not use it.  You will still be able to see the line you are tracking, but may look to the side more often than with a typical mower.  The trade-off is worth it for the time and effort saved versus raking, trust me.  During spring and early summer, with the shortened bag, line-of-sight is practically the same as with a regular mower.  Again, achieving acceptable line-of-sight was required for me to use the system myself.
 
Q: Will all the leaves be picked up on the first pass?
A: No, not completely.  There will be some fragments that get left behind as mulch.  But then again, think about the performance of your raking or conventional mowing...I am guessing some gets left behind.  The difference with Direct-Bag-It is that the process overall takes so much less time and effort.  By general observation, I would say 75-85% of the leaves are bagged on the first pass.  The bulk of the leaves are collected and there will be a clear line of where you have been.  If desired, a reverse or second pass probably gets you into the +95% range.  Bagging the leaves in a counter-clockwise loop makes a big difference as excess typically flows to the left side of the system.  The concentric loops serve to corral the leaves to their eventual doom.  The same loop-wise method is not necessary while mowing during grass seasons.
 
Q: Will Direct-Bag-It vacuum my sidewalk and driveway?
A: Not exactly.  One my discoveries while using the system was that good grass helps to form a seal between the mower deck and the ground.  Without grass to perform that function, leaves and debris on hard surfaces tend to swirl out from underneath the deck leading to incomplete collection.  Deck height can be adjusted some to alleviate this, but generally your best bet is to move the debris to the lawn to bag it from there.
 
Q: Does Direct-Bag-It clog?
A: It can, but fortunately the transfer tube is easy to clear.  The main culprit is pushing too quickly over dense leaves or grass.  Under normal conditions you can push Direct-Bag-It just as fast as a regular mower, however, just like you would slow down with a regular mower in thick areas, you’ll need to do the same with Direct-Bag-It.  Sticks can also start a clog, so a stick pickup prior to mowing is a good idea.  Again, something that usually makes sense to do anytime you mow.
 
Q: Does the fill chute ever disconnect from the bag?
A: It can, but fortunately the fill chute plastic band is adjustable to minimize this occurrence.  A tight seal is important for keeping the fill chute connected.  I have noticed that from lot-to-lot, bag sizes do change enough to affect the seal.  So, if it is too loose, I expand the ring out.  If it is too tight (worse case, torn bag), I adjust the ring in.  I think outdoor temperature can have an effect as well requiring some adjustment, but I am still evaluating that.
 
Q: Is Direct-Bag-It Safe?
A: Insofar as lawn mowers are safe, Direct-Bag-It is safe.  All of the risks traditionally associated with rotary push mowers are present.  Additional considerations include clearing clogs and disconnect of the fill chute from the yard bag while bagging.  If you need to clear a clog from the discharge adapter, the spark plug wire should be disconnected to prevent accidental operation of the motor.  If the fill chute disconnects from the yard bag, immediately release the mower safety handle, causing the engine to stop.  Operators should wear personal protective equpment for eye sight and hearing.
 
Q: How will you provide support and what are the terms of sale?
A: My expectation is that as an early adopter of a beta prototype Direct-Bag-It, you will provide me feedback I can use to continually improve the system.  I want the good and the bad, the latter of which I hope is few and far between.  I don't really know how this will evolve with multiple systems "out in the wild," but I can assure you that I want you to be happy with the system.   I will try to make reasonable accommodations for any issue you may encounter and handle each on a case-by-case basis.  I am still working with legal to draft specific terms of sale, but generally I plan to provide a 30-day money-back guarantee.
 
Q: What do you need and why?
A: I basically need to set up shop for some light fabrication, assembly, packaging, and shipping of the system; yes, in my garage.  Hopefully this will be another "started in the garage" business success story.
 
Band Saw – This will allow me to cut the discharge adapter pipe and bag holder panels.

$545      Grizzly 14in
$79        shipping
$65        roller base
$0          shipping
$13        band saw book
$0          shipping
 
Drill Press – I need this so that I can drill holes in the inlet adapter and bag holder panels.

$120      Skil 10in
$0         free shipping
 
Work Table – I will need a large, sturdy work surface.

$290      72 x 36 Ash top
$125      shipping
 
Dust Collection –This will collect the dust from my power tools.

$175      Wall mount, light duty
$36        4" dia x 20' Hose
$20        shipping
 
Video Camera – Why write and print a manual when I can create how-to videos online?  This camera will help me create the user guide as well as aide in testing and diagnostics.

$400      Hero Go Pro 3 Black
$0          shipping
$100      accessories
$0          shipping
 
Tools, bits, bins, misc – This is my catchall for things I will likely need.

$1,000   Tools, bits, misc
 
Professional Services – Because it's what you're supposed to do when starting a business

$5000    Legal, accounting, and insurance
 
Total:  $7468   
The remainder of the funding is applied toward material costs, perks, campaign fees, and hopefully if things go well a modest profit to fund future development.
 
Project Risks and Challenges
I am sure there are expected and unexpeded are challenges lurking.  I have already overcome many to get this far, so I am confident I can overcome any that are ahead.
With anything that is manufactured, parts avaialability and delivery timeline can cause issues.  I have contacted suppliers of key components to let them know the level of orders that may occur.  That said, until you really submit that PO, it's hard to know whether what you need will arrive on time and at the budgeted cost.  Rest assured, if supply chain issues are detected, I will communicate those to you with an estimate of impact to delivery date.
I am just at the point of receiving test-fit parts for assembly of the beta-prototype of Direct-Bag-It.  There is some risk that parts will not assemble or operate as I expect, however, I should have time to resolve those prior purchasing for these orders.
Weather is a concern for my hands-on demonstration perks.  If we have a very wet fall it may be difficult to schedule and make all the rounds.
 
Last But Not Least
Thank you to my family, friends, and professional partners for helping this product get to this stage!  I am sure I will continue to lean on you as this moves forward.   Let's make it happen!

And, Thank You! for considering my campaign.  If you have any questions or comments, I can be reached at andrew@topdownengineering.com
