story:
Introducing Nobile N1 Jacket

The ultimate Extreme Venture Survivor Jacket

The Nobile N1 Extreme Venture Survivor (EVS) Jacket is one of a kind – because of its technical materials, intelligent accessories, range of uses and the results you’ll achieve. It protects from the outside against adverse weather conditions, and shields from the inside against electrosmog. At the same time, it offers intelligent solutions so that you can get about without compromise, in town and in the countryside. Because we like freedom and extreme conditions, without giving up anything. Surviving always, anywhere. We are Extreme Venture Survivors, like all of you, every day, in all environments.  

•    Internal Multimedia Pocket: the first and only one of its kind, shields the body against electromagnetic radiation from your mobile telephone.  

•    “Oblò" Porthole: a transparent window with touch film and windproof protective cover: a solution never seen before in a jacket, for keeping your smartwatch protected against water, wind, snow and cold, and providing maximum protection for your battery.

• Zero Waste Jacket: The Nobile N1 jacket comes with a booklet for use and maintenance. It can also be subjected to reconditioning; with the reuse of clothing reduces CO2 emissions, the use of water, pesticides and fertilizers.

•    EVS Tech Fabric: water-repellent, windproof, stainproof, coldproof.  

•    Thermo Regulation Slide (TRS) zips: to maintain an ideal body temperature (promotes thermoregulation and dehumification).  

•    Rear ‘Ballonett’ Pocket: a super-intelligent waterproof pocket to hold all your wet items.

 

Tecnical Features Details

Here is a summary of the innovative technical features of the Nobile N1 EVS:

 

Focus on each Feature: 

 1) "Oblò" Smartwatch Porthole

 

 

Through its touch film and the protective windproof cover, you will not have to take cold or work hard to access your wrist device! This solution still never offered in a jacket, will allow you to use your Smart Watch keeping it safe from water, wind, snow and cold and thus safeguarding its battery to the maximum! The innovative protective film will allow you to access the smartphone through gloves equipped with touch technology!

 

2) Multimedia Tecnostan® Pocket

Every day we are exposed to many electromagnetic fields that subject us to radiation from the doubtful benefit on our health. From our research we have identified an innovative material, developed in Italy in a composite material made out of Silver, Copper and Carpholite. This patented technology, recognized by the CNR (Italian National Research Council) with register n. 0002619\2014, allows to reduce electromagnetic radiation up to 55% V\m (Volt\Meter) for frequencies at 900 MHz and even up to 60% V\m radiation at frequencies 1.8 Ghz (commonly emitted by mobile phones).

 

3) Zero Waste Jacket

The Nobile N1 jacket comes with a booklet for use and maintenance. It will be possible to submit it to a reconditioning, a service that includes the anti-water treatment over the external shell, the replacement of portholes and the zip 'TRS'. The service will be available on our web-site and we will offer repair in 4 weeks! We have chosen to offer this service because we care about the environment, in fact with the re-use of 1 kg of clothes are reduced:  
- CO2 emission up to 3.6 kg; 
- consumption of water up to 6000 liters; 
- use of fertilizers up to 0.3 kg; 
- use of pesticides up to 0.2 kg.

 

4) "Thermo Regulation Slide" (TRS) Zips

To allow thermo-regulation and greater breathability of the body we have introduced ergonomic inserts under the armpits! The expulsion of humidity is also a necessary condition in physical stress during extreme outdoor temperatures, dehumidification prevents possible freezing!

 

5) "Ballonett" Rear Pocket

We cannot always have access or be able to carry a backpack, in order to derive more space we have inserted this super-smart pocket for the storage of wet or bulky objects! Its name derives from the navigation compartments of the zeppelin airships, which allowed vertical navigation and guaranteed the possibility of having more transport space on board!

 

6) "EVS Tech" Fabric

The innovative Taslan EVS Tech is water-resistant, windproof, stain-resistant, anti-cold: all you need to face the world! Its technology consists of several elements, an air extruded yarn allows the synthetic fiber to take the shape of the cotton thread, thus allowing a great freedom of movement, the PVC coating and the anti-water surface treatment allow an efficient shielding from the adverse weather!

 

Choose your Reward

To achive our target (the production of the Nobile N1 EVS Jacket) we need also your help! Choose your reward and be one of the first to wear a Nobile N1 Jacket!

Choose your Size

The Nobile N1 reward is available in 4 sizes (M/Medium, L/Large, XL/Extra Large, XXL/Double Extra Large) and in 3 colours (Gray, Black, Orange Persimmon Limited Edition) in the following chart you will find the measures to compare with your favourite jacket or one that better fits your body. Pay attention all the measures are in Centimeters (cm): 1cm is equal to 0.39 inches.  

How you do it

You can easly choose your size measuring your favourite jacket (or the oneyou that better fits your body): check the width of the chest and bottom and the lenght of the sleeve (from your neck to your wrist). For example if your favourite jacket's sleeve is 32 inches, its bottom width is 23 inches and its chest width is 24 inches, your size will be the L (Large).

 

Every day Use: Motorbike or bike?!

Noble N1 EVS at work! Tesed on the bike and on the scooter to reach any destination, both for work and for spare time!

 

Nobile N1 on the test: water and stains!

Always protected, clean and dry!

 

Do not miss the opportunity to share with us the NOBILE N1 Jacket: BACK US NOW!

 

Risks and challenges

We have originally launched this crowdfunding campaigns on Kickstarter, and it has been founded ate the end of june! So we have achieved our dream of producing the innovative Svalbard Islands Nobile N1 jacket, an item that will revolutionise our way of enjoying the outdoors.

This InDemand campaign have the aim of raising  more funds according to a reward-based model, allowing us to spread the distribution of our jacket and let you test its with perfect fit and its wide range of innovative technical accessories and solution.

Up to now  (mid July) we have started the production process, we have already faced the bulck prototype production steps and we are facing the final production steps! The rewards we are proposing in exchange to our backers will cover our commercial costs for the first lot!

Noble N1 EVS at work! Tesed on the bike and on the scooter to reach any destination, both for work and for spare time!

story:
totWatch® - The Most Reliable, Smart, Safety Device for Toddlers. Helping busy moms keep toddlers safe.

How does the totWatch® solution work?

A miniaturized Personal Safety Device worn by a toddler and securely connected to the smartphone of a babysitter, caregiver or parent via a password protected link. A proprietary alarm processing system triggers a real-time alarm and notifies a caregiver and parents as soon as the system recognizes any threat to a child.

 

 

Why totWatch®?

totWatch® is not a tracking device. Unlike any other child safety solution currently available on the market, totWatch® is the only smart safety device for children that provides truly reliable user-frendly, real-time safety alerts straight to your phone or any other phone worldwide. Currently some features are available only in the continental USA/Canada and for the iPhone 4S, iPhone5 and google Nexus 4. More smart phone applications and countries are coming soon.

  • Reliable
  • Smart
  • User-friendly
  • Real-time
  • FREE

Statistics

  • 90% of families are impacted by ‘accidental wandering’
  • 7 out of 10 children get lost at least once
  • 58,000+ children have been reported abducted by non-family members 
  • Nearly 75% of parents in the US fear their children might be abducted
  • 94% of mothers are extremely worried about their children while they are away.

 

totWatch®

totWatch® - The world's first most reliable smart personal safety solution for toddlers that seamlessly blends advanced mobile technology in a child friendly device and addresses 3 major threats:

  • wandering away

  • drowning

  • kidnapping

 

It delivers confidence and peace of mind to busy moms and dads and provides real-time safety alerts straight to your phone or any other phone. In the pictures presented below you see two different DEMO units we built to test our system in both a clip-on and wrist-onmodel. Stylish looking cases will be designed by one of our experienced industrial designers. You as a contributor will have a chance to vote for you favorite designs.

 VS.

Our progress 

In three years we’ve come a long way. Here is what we’ve done so far. From left to right.

Picture 1: Prototype #1(water sensor) was our first proof of a concept. As you can see it required A4 page format to be set up. However, this was our first prototype which we used to succesfully complete our first water sensor in both fresh and salt water.

Picture 2: Prototype #2(square) was the first prototype which we were able to put in the palm of your hand. It was able to connect to our test SmartPhone application and transmit data. 

Picture 2: Prototype #3(in the middle) was our first prototype that used standard micro-components and tested three major threads: drowning, wandering away, abduction.

Picture 2: Prototype #4 was our first fully functional prototype (the size of a quarter), it was able to connect to our cloud based alert processing system via smartphone and become a truly reliable smart mobile solution for children.

Picture 3 and 4: Our lab. 

 

 

Screenshots of totWatch the Demo Smartphone Application

 

About us 

Guardian Angels Electronics (GAE) is a Canadian based start-up company in Vancouver, BC specializing in the newly emerging field of Mobile Personal Safety using advanced M2M technology. We are a team of highly experienced professionals whose main goal is saving the lives of those who are not capable of requesting help when needed by reducing the response time in life threatening or dangerous situations. Read more about us and our company: www.guardianangelselectronics.com/about-us.html

Our recent event

BCTIA - TechBrew 

Questions? Comments? Suggestions?

Email: aostapyshyn@guanel.com

Phone: 604-762-1518

 

Use of Capital 

We understand that you put a lot of faith in our team to deliver on our promise.We partnered with a local manufacturer that will assemble and certify our devices. Our team is responsible for the design and development of hardware and software. We will not cut corners on the safety of your children. We will not outsource any of the development. We will keep the entire process as lean as possible and keep costs down. Here is where we will spend the money.

  • Design and mold a safe and child-friendly enclousure
  • Complete Cloud-based Alert Processing System
  • Complete Smartphone Application
  • Manufacture totWatch® and fulfill our orders

Risk Management

Having tremendous experience working with international teams across the globe, we decided the best way to guarantee quality and deliverables in such a short term is to work in a small local team. Therefore, all hardware and software components will be designed and developed locally in Vancouver, Canada. Our company is an active member of a few well known IT and business organizations such as IRAP, BCTIA and Wavefront We are privileged to have a chance to work with them and receive support of our innitiative such as:  access to much needed technical experts, industry knowledge, test equipment, business development, and guarantee a solution to any challenge that may arise.

We have vigorously tested all our prototypes and now have released a pre-production version. That means that you won't be surprised by unexpected product challenges.

We are a committed team of professionals that have a proven record of working with start-up product development and have support from extremely well connected and talented members on our board of directors. They not only help us to manage strategic direction, but are also involved in the tactical decision making process.  Please read about us on our web-site. www.guardianangelselectronics.com/about-us.html

In addition, we are securing additional financial support from another organization that will reduce financial risk even further.

FAQ 

Is totWatch® really the most reliable personal safety solution for children?

YES! Inspired by the most sophisticated online payment processing systems such as VISA and MasterCard Card, we designed a simple yet very reliable personal safety system. Even if there is not a cellular network you can use the essential safety features. Your totWatch® cannot be disconnected, removed, lost, or destroyed without you knowing it. The patented cloud based system works 24/7/365 and you are the only person in the world that can stop it.

How do I know it's Smart?

Unlike any other safety devices for children that simply works on basic hardware alert processing within a device, totWatch® uses a unique advanced technology that supports your busy lifestyle while helping keep your children safe. The system educates itself using proprietary algorithms to enhance your child's safety while reducing false alarms and your stress level.

Is it User-friendly for me and my baby?

YES. totWatch® is a flexible smartphone based solution that is easy to use and is child friendly. It's a truly customizable system that comes in a pre-configured package. However, it can be used "as-is". A Long lasting battery its extra light-weight (~20gr) allows you to fully enjoy whatever you do and let totWatch® take care of the rest. It comes in a wrist-on or clicp-on device to fit your baby's style.

Is totWatch® a Real-time solution?

YES. There is nothing better than the gift of time. It is a tragedy to realize something happend to your child too late. Our system delivers real-time alerts directly to your smart-phone. Our multiple phone version is available and will keep trying to alert you and your child's caregiver untill you or your caregiver stops it. Guaranteed. 

How does totWatch® work?

We built a simple system, that supports your busy lifestyle while providing a reliable safety solution for your child.

  1. Get your totWatch®
  2. Download a FREE Smartphone application
  3. Put totWatch® on your child

Relax and Enjoy your children!!
story_txt:
totWatch® - The Most Reliable, Smart, Safety Device for Toddlers. Helping busy moms keep toddlers safe.

How does the totWatch® solution work?
A miniaturized Personal Safety Device worn by a toddler and securely connected to the smartphone of a babysitter, caregiver or parent via a password protected link. A proprietary alarm processing system triggers a real-time alarm and notifies a caregiver and parents as soon as the system recognizes any threat to a child.

 
 

Why totWatch®?

totWatch® is not a tracking device. Unlike any other child safety solution currently available on the market, totWatch® is the only smart safety device for children that provides truly reliable user-frendly, real-time safety alerts straight to your phone or any other phone worldwide. story:
Business cards. In the age of LinkedIn, smartphones, and a million contact apps, they can seem kind of anachronistic. But they're still the preferred way of handing over your contact information at job fairs, expos, and conventions, and a key part of the job hunt. Business cards may seem out of date, but they're actually more popular than ever. In fact, they're so popular...

...it can be kind of a problem. Many VIP's, recruiters, or vendors end fairs or trade shows with hundreds of cards, which they either summarily throw away, or scan into their app of choice and then promptly forget about. You can try to make your business card flashy or colorful to get attention, but there's a lot of flashy cards out there now too, and you run the risk of looking unprofessional. The school does provide us with an "official" business card template:

Not bad, but I think I have a cool alternative:

After doing some research, I think the best alternate card option out there is metal. They're standout and impressive without being flashy or unprofessional. Metal business cards are laser cut out of stainless steel, which fits the technological "vibe" of the program well, and the minimalist look is definitely "in" in tech right now.

 Metal cards also offer options that are impossible on paper cards, like a logo cutout or alternative interior shapes:

Bottom line, we're all here to build an amazing program and get awesome jobs doing it, and if some cooler cards will help that goal, we can make that happen!

Awesome cards, got it. So how does this work?

Metal cards aren't that expensive (about $2 each), but the template for them has to be custom made. If we want a really good designer making our class cards (and we do), it'll be a few hundred dollars total. This campaign will raise the money to create a fantastic class card template, and help us stand out from other job applicants.

Couldn't someone in class design them? We have a few graphics artists.

Very possible! But excellent design takes time, and time is not something we have a lot of right now. The design will run through several iterations, during which the artists in class (and everyone else) will be able to offer feedback, but I didn't think it was practical to ask any of our resident artists to also take on a big design project.

So what is this card actually going to look like when it's done?

Suggestions are welcome, and there will be multiple iterations of design for the class to choose from, but right now, the notion is that it's going to look something like the three cards you can see above. It needs to include our school logo, a unique identifier for Johnson and NYC tech, and an elegant incorporation of our LinkedIn information that many traditional cards lack. The goal is something elegant and simple, the same size and dimensions as a standard card, but with a clear theme. As the card says:

 Who is actually going to do the design?

I intend to solicit drafts from MyMetalBuisnessCards  , PlasmaDesign  , MetalCards  , eLance  , and 99Designs  , with the final selection (after filtering and review of some of our artists) to be made by the class.

What if I want more than 20?

The template, once available, can be used to print all the cards you like at your leisure! Every student who backs will get a copy with their contact information.

Can I order cards later if I don't donate now?

Sorry, but each card file is designed with a specific name and set of contact information on it, so it won't be possible to simply print out your own variant later. No free riders here—if you want the cool cards, you need to chip in.

What if there's not-enough/too-much money?

I've padded the budget fairly heavily, so I'm not seriously concerned we'll fall short. If there's money left over, it'll be used to create additional variant cards, such as plastic, RFID enabled, etc.

Are there any stretch goals?

Just one! At $3,000, we get other cool card designs, like RFID enabled cards, plastic, mini-metal, etc.

story:
Campaign Highlights

  • Swiss powered mechanical watches for every day. Hand assembled in the US with exclusive campaign pricing starting at $474 (normally $599).

  • Unique in-house designs offering timeless cool with modern performance.

  • *Or submit your personal designs for a chance to get them produced and earn you a royalty for every watch sold on the new McKinley Community Platform.

  • McKinley Community Platform allows you to vote on what we make and sell.

  • All watches are unisex and feature best-in-class materials.

 

At The McKinley Watch Company,

we believe in championing

great design.

 

We’re built on 2 key principles:

  • To deliver best-in-class, purposefully designed, Swiss-powered mechanical watches for every day.

  • To provide a platform that gives watch enthusiasts everywhere a voice: a voice to vote on what we make and an opportunity to submit their personal designs, to have those designs produced, and to pay them a royalty for every watch sold.

 

First things first, let's start with our

In-House Designs

 

The Skylark is our first GMT watch. Its design harkens back to the pilot watches of the 1940's and 1950's. As a GMT watch, the Skylark can track two time zones simultaneously via the 4th hand and the 24-hour clock on the outer edge of the dial.

 

The Ogden is our slim-profile dress watch. Its design was influenced by the bold and "space age" designs of the mid-20th century - a style that is, unfortunately, rare in modern watches.

 

The Archer is our homage to the classic field watch. It features a high contrast dial and hour markers, as well as 24-hour reference markers. The name is a not-so-subtle reference to the broad arrows featured on WW2-era British military watches.

Additional specs and images of these watches below.

Please note: The Ogden and Archer models are stretch goals and will only be made available for preorder if our stretch goal targets are met.

 

Have a personal watch design you want to see come to life? Oh, and get paid for every one of your watches sold?

 

User Submitted Designs

 

Being obsessed with design means championing great design - regardless of where it comes from.

If you spend any time on the watch communities online, on the watch blogs, or talking to watch enthusiasts, you quickly realize that there is an ocean of untapped creative talent out there. So, we've made it part of our mission to provide a platform that gives watch enthusiasts everywhere that voice.

Vote for what we make. The most immediate way to make your voice heard is to vote on our website and social media for your favorite user-submitted designs. Anyone anywhere can submit a vote.

Submit your own design. Have a personal design you've been obsessing about? Is there a completely new style that you'd like to introduce to the world? Or a vintage style that you would love to see make a comeback? These are all reasons why we're creating the MyMcKinley platform.

 

Here's how it's going to work:

Call for Design Submissions

We will periodically put out a call for new watch design submissions. This would be the perfect time to submit that personal watch design you've been obsessing about.

 

Submission review

Once the submission period is closed, the team will review all submissions and shortlist a select group of designs based on uniqueness, production feasibility and relevance to the brand's design aesthetic. What does that mean? Odds are that a super-hero themed, 70mm, neon colored quartz watch won't make the cut.

 

Design finalists revealed

Once selected, we will publicly post the design finalists for the first time on our website and across our social media and invite the public to vote for their favorite design. Again, everyone and anyone will be able to cast a vote, but only community members can submit designs.

 

A winner is chosen

The design with the most votes at the end of the voting period wins and will get produced and sold on our website. In exchange, the winning designer will earn a 5% royalty for every watch sold.

 

Small print.

  • We have 0% interest in stealing anyone's intellectual property. All designs remain property of its designer up to the point that a winner is selected. It then becomes property of The Mckinley Watch Company in exchange for royalties to the designer.

  • Designs will remain confidential up to the point that they get shortlisted and posted for voting.

  • There will be a weighted system applied to the voting. For example, a vote accompanied with a pre-order for that design will be weighed more heavily that a simple single vote.

  • The goal is to bring these designs to life and maximize royalties for the designer.

 

And now, back to our in-house designs.

 

Skylark images and specs:

  • 2893-2 movement from industry-leading Swiss watchmaker, ETA
  • GMT complication (2nd time zone)
  • 50-hour power reserve, 21 jewels
  • 39mm case, polished 316L stainless steel
  • Screw down case back with flat sapphire exhibition window and 316L stainless steel
  • Screw down crown
  • 10ATM (100 meters) water resistance
  • Double-domed sapphire glass with anti-reflective coating
  • 12.5mm thickness
  • Thick printed hour indices with Super-Luminova lume
  • 20mm lug width, 50mm lug to lug size

 

 

Ogden images and specs:

  • SW300-1 movement from powerhouse Swiss watchmaker Sellita
  • 56-hour power reserve, 25 jewels
  • 39mm case, polished 316L stainless steel
  • Screw down case back with flat sapphire exhibition window and 316L stainless steel
  • 5ATM (50 meters) water resistance
  • Sapphire glass with anti-reflective coating
  • Slim 9.45mm thickness
  • Applied hour indices
  • 20mm lug width, 44.6mm lug to lug size

 

 

Archer images and specs:

  • SW215-1 movement from powerhouse Swiss watchmaker, Sellita
  • 45-hour power reserve, 19 jewels
  • 39mm case, polished 316L stainless steel
  • Screw down case back with flat sapphire exhibition window and 316L stainless steel
  • Screw down crown
  • 10ATM (100 meters) water resistance
  • Double-domed sapphire glass with anti-reflective coating
  • 12.5mm thickness
  • Painted hands with Super-Luminova lume accents
  • Thick printed hour indices with Super-Luminova lume
  • 20mm lug width, 50mm lug to lug size

 

Please note: The Ogden and Archer models are stretch goals and will only be made available for preorder if our stretch goal targets are met.

 

    Straps

    There are three watch strap options available for your new watch. All are custom colors and feature an engraved buckle with lie-flat prong to help prevent it from catching on clothes and other fabrics.

    • Tan Suede Strap - Made of genuine Suede in Pantone Color 7510 C.
    • Brown Leather Strap - Made of genuine Leather in Pantone Color 723 C.
    • Stone Suede Strap - Made of genuine Suede in Pantone Color 7527 C.

     

    * Please note: Images are for illustration purposes only. Actual colors may appear different from above renderings.

       

      Limited Edition Watches

       

       

      To commemorate our launch, we're rewarding our backers with limited edition versions of our in-house watches. Each watch will feature an "OP '21" mark that commemorates the launch year and denotes that its owner is an Original Patron.

      Only 300 hundred watches of each design will ever be produced with this mark, and you can only get these special edition watches here and now.

      You will not see this mark an any future designs or launches.

       

      Complimentary Limited-Edition Prints

      Just as exclusive will be our complimentary limited edition commemorative prints. 

      Every backer who pre-orders a watch will receive a free 11” x 17" (279.4mm x 431.8mm) print that highlights their watch and the spirit of the brand. The prints, which were inspired by the vintage travel ads of the early 20th century, will be printed on archival matte paper and will be individually numbered.

      And again, you can only get these special edition prints here and now.

       

      The Skylark Print is a play on our belief that good design speaks for itself and naturally gets noticed - something that we hope speaks true of the Skylark and all of our designs.

       

      The Ogden Print. The basic concept for this print came to me very early on. As a decades long rider of public transportation in my home city of Chicago IL, the subway car became my inspiration for this image of riders on the subway.

      You first notice a sea of hands, all with smart watches except for one hand featuring the Ogden. The watches were aligned in a way to make the Ogden stand out. It's meant to stand out, the watch was designed to look different than anything else.

      If you look closely at the ads along the top of the train car, you'll notice that they read: "They may be smart, but they don't have heart". This is a reference to that fact that while smart watches are trendy and can do a million things, there's still value and beauty in an invention that has done one thing, so elegantly, for over 500 years. And especially in the escapement mechanism that is its beating heart. Just because something is new doesn't mean that it's better.

       

      The Archer Print is meant to capture that feeling of getting away from the office on a beautiful Friday after work. The caption on the bottom emphasizes that there's more to life than work - something that I know a lot of us often lose sight of.

       

      Exclusive Campaign Pricing

      Backers who preorder a watch will save up to $200 off of retail by taking advantage of our special campaign pricing.

      Please note: The Ogden and Archer models are stretch goals and will only be made available for preorder if our stretch goal targets are met.

       

       

      Perks

      Backers who support our campaign can choose from a number of contribution options and perks.

      Pre-order a watch

      Backers who wish to pre-order a watch will receive a special edition, limited availability mechanical watch (only 300 “OP ‘21” watches of each design will ever be made) at a discount that is only available here and now.

      Additionally, backers who preorder a watch will receive a complimentary, 11" x 17" (279.4mm x 431.8mm) print featuring custom artwork highlighting their new watch.

      Please note: The Ogden and Archer models are stretch goals and will only be made available for preorder if our stretch goal targets are met.

      Store Credits

      Backers can also select a store credit as a perk. In return for your pledge, you'll get a heavily discounted store credit that can be used on a future purchase*  from our online store.

      There are 3 options available:

      • A pledge of $25 will receive a $50 store credit
      • A pledge of $55 will receive a $125 store credit
      • A pledge of $75 will receive a $175 store credit

      *One store credit per transaction of equal or greater value.

       

      Pledge because you believe

      Backers can also choose to support the campaign without the expectation of a perk, just to say that you believe in us and our new platform.

       

       

       

      Packaging and Environmental Commitments

      At the McKinley Watch Company, we believe companies should be conscious of their impact on the environment. Nowhere is this more critical than with product packaging.

      Rather than ship our watches in cumbersome watch boxes (that often are never used again) and enclosed in layers of plastic, we'll be shipping our watches in functional and sustainable packaging.

      Waterproof Canvas Watch Roll

      All watches will be shipped in a waterproof canvas watch roll that is perfect for storing your watches at home or while traveling. Made of high-quality waxed canvas with soft suede lining, our watch rolls can accommodate up to five 46mm watches and accessories.

      Final watch roll design is still being finalized. We will update the campaign page with product photography once product samples are approved and photographed.

      Product Packaging

      Every effort will be made to only use recyclable and/or sustainable product packaging for everything from corrugated cardboard to packing paper and tape.

       

      Warranty and Shipping

      • All watches are professionally regulated (in 6 positions) after assembly.
      • All watches come with 1-year warranty that covers defective parts and workmanship. It does not coveraccidental damage or water damage.
      • Free shipping worldwide to most countries (please message us with any questions/concerns).
      • For orders outside of the US, backers will be responsible for shipping and any applicable duty/VAT charges.

       

      What will we use the funds for?

      Production

      Production and assembly costs for our watches account for the majority of the funds required for this campaign.

      Product Development

      Resources will be used for further product development on our watches (additional color options and styles), straps (additional colors, materials, and clasps), wallet rolls (additional materials and functionality) and packaging.

      Legal

      Any project that deals with intellectual property (IP) requires legal counsel and the drafting of specific, detailed contracts that protect both the designer and company.

      Web Development

      Resources will be needed to build our online store and community platform.

      Sourcing

      Resources will be needed to secure additional vendor and supplier partners in order to increase capacity and expand product offerings.

      Creative

      Additional creative resources will be required to drive the creation of new ads, designs, and digital content. Everything to this point has been created exclusively by Juan and his basic knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite, so we will need to invest in the expertise of professional creatives!

       

      Timeline

       

       

      Risks and Challenges

      Lead-times. Unfortunately, there is always a risk that suppliers will not fulfill orders on time or that there are other unforeseen delays with production and delivery. However, we're only working with vendors with whom we have an established relationship and long history of past watch collaborations. These products are tried and true.

      We will continue to work closely with these partners to try to anticipate and mitigate any potential delays in production and to make sure we communicate any risk to the timeline with our backers ASAP.

      We are committed to being transparent with our backers and our community with regards to the timeline and will actively be communicating about the process every step of the way.

       

      About Us

       

      Juan has spent the last decade designing and launching millions of products for some of the biggest companies in the world. After earning an MBA from the University of Illinois Champaign-Urbana, he went on to become a strategic promotional and product partner with companies such as General Mills, Kellogg’s, and Danone. Most recently he has worked as a senior product manager for Stanley Black & Decker and Honeywell. Juan has spent the last 5 years obsessing about watches and EVERY detail of this project while continuing to research the watch industry, meet with trained watch makers, and traveling domestically and abroad to consult with watch manufacturers and vendors.

       

       

      Founded in 2007, Wiegand Custom Watch, LLC is a family-run business based in the city of Mentor, Ohio USA. They build their watches using only the highest-grade parts from all over the globe including Switzerland, France, Japan, USA, and Germany. LÜM-TEC is their showcase brand featuring handcrafted watches built by professional watchmakers.

       

      Thank you for visiting our campaign page. We are looking forward to hearing from you!

      -The McKinley Watch Co.
story_txt:
Campaign Highlights
Swiss powered mechanical watches for every day. Hand assembled in the US with exclusive campaign pricing starting at $474 (normally $599).
Unique in-house designs offering timeless cool with modern performance.
*Or submit your personal designs for a chance to get them produced and earn you a royalty for every watch sold on the new McKinley Community Platform.
McKinley Community Platform allows you to vote on what we make and sell.
All watches are unisex and feature best-in-class materials.
 At The McKinley Watch Company,we believe in championinggreat design. We’re built on 2 key principles:
To deliver best-in-class, purposefully designed, Swiss-powered mechanical watches for every day.
To provide a platform that gives watch enthusiasts everywhere a voice: a voice to vote on what we make and an opportunity to submit their personal designs, to have those designs produced, and to pay them a royalty for every watch sold.
 First things first, let's start with ourIn-House Designs The Skylark is our first GMT watch. Its design harkens back to the pilot watches of the 1940's and 1950's. As a GMT watch, the Skylark can track two time zones simultaneously via the 4th hand and the 24-hour clock on the outer edge of the dial. The Ogden is our slim-profile dress watch. Its design was influenced by the bold and "space age" designs of the mid-20th century - a style that is, unfortunately, rare in modern watches. The Archer is our homage to the classic field watch. It features a high contrast dial and hour markers, as well as 24-hour reference markers. The name is a not-so-subtle reference to the broad arrows featured on WW2-era British military watches.Additional specs and images of these watches below.Please note: The Ogden and Archer models are stretch goals and will only be made available for preorder if our stretch goal targets are met. Have a personal watch design you want to see come to life? Oh, and get paid for every one of your watches sold? User Submitted Designs Being obsessed with design means championing great design - regardless of where it comes from.If you spend any time on the watch communities online, on the watch blogs, or talking to watch enthusiasts, you quickly realize that there is an ocean of untapped creative talent out there. So, we've made it part of our mission to provide a platform that gives watch enthusiasts everywhere that voice.Vote for what we make. The most immediate way to make your voice heard is to vote on our website and social media for your favorite user-submitted designs. Anyone anywhere can submit a vote.Submit your own design. Have a personal design you've been obsessing about? Is there a completely new style that you'd like to introduce to the world? Or a vintage style that you would love to see make a comeback? These are all reasons why we're creating the MyMcKinley platform. Here's how it's going to work:Call for Design SubmissionsWe will periodically put out a call for new watch design submissions. This would be the perfect time to submit that personal watch design you've been obsessing about. Submission reviewOnce the submission period is closed, the team will review all submissions and shortlist a select group of designs based on uniqueness, production feasibility and relevance to the brand's design aesthetic. What does that mean? Odds are that a super-hero themed, 70mm, neon colored quartz watch won't make the cut. Design finalists revealedOnce selected, we will publicly post the design finalists for the first time on our website and across our social media and invite the public to vote for their favorite design. Again, everyone and anyone will be able to cast a vote, but only community members can submit designs. A winner is chosenThe design with the most votes at the end of the voting period wins and will get produced and sold on our website. In exchange, the winning designer will earn a 5% royalty for every watch sold. Small print.
We have 0% interest in stealing anyone's intellectual property. All designs remain property of its designer up to the point that a winner is selected. It then becomes property of The Mckinley Watch Company in exchange for royalties to the designer.
Designs will remain confidential up to the point that they get shortlisted and posted for voting.
There will be a weighted system applied to the voting. For example, a vote accompanied with a pre-order for that design will be weighed more heavily that a simple single vote.
The goal is to bring these designs to life and maximize royalties for the designer.
 And now, back to our in-house designs.
 
Skylark images and specs:
2893-2 movement from industry-leading Swiss watchmaker, ETA
GMT complication (2nd time zone)
50-hour power reserve, 21 jewels
39mm case, polished 316L stainless steel
Screw down case back with flat sapphire exhibition window and 316L stainless steel
Screw down crown
10ATM (100 meters) water resistance
Double-domed sapphire glass with anti-reflective coating
12.5mm thickness
Thick printed hour indices with Super-Luminova lume
20mm lug width, 50mm lug to lug size
  
Ogden images and specs:
SW300-1 movement from powerhouse Swiss watchmaker Sellita
56-hour power reserve, 25 jewels
39mm case, polished 316L stainless steel
Screw down case back with flat sapphire exhibition window and 316L stainless steel
5ATM (50 meters) water resistance
Sapphire glass with anti-reflective coating
Slim 9.45mm thickness
Applied hour indices
20mm lug width, 44.6mm lug to lug size
  
Archer images and specs:
SW215-1 movement from powerhouse Swiss watchmaker, Sellita
45-hour power reserve, 19 jewels
39mm case, polished 316L stainless steel
Screw down case back with flat sapphire exhibition window and 316L stainless steel
Screw down crown
10ATM (100 meters) water resistance
Double-domed sapphire glass with anti-reflective coating
12.5mm thickness
Painted hands with Super-Luminova lume accents
Thick printed hour indices with Super-Luminova lume
20mm lug width, 50mm lug to lug size
 Please note: The Ogden and Archer models are stretch goals and will only be made available for preorder if our stretch goal targets are met. StrapsThere are three watch strap options available for your new watch. All are custom colors and feature an engraved buckle with lie-flat prong to help prevent it from catching on clothes and other fabrics.
Tan Suede Strap - Made of genuine Suede in Pantone Color 7510 C.
Brown Leather Strap - Made of genuine Leather in Pantone Color 723 C.
Stone Suede Strap - Made of genuine Suede in Pantone Color 7527 C.
 * Please note: Images are for illustration purposes only. Actual colors may appear different from above renderings. Limited Edition Watches  To commemorate our launch, we're rewarding our backers with limited edition versions of our in-house watches. Each watch will feature an "OP '21" mark that commemorates the launch year and denotes that its owner is an Original Patron.Only 300 hundred watches of each design will ever be produced with this mark, and you can only get these special edition watches here and now.You will not see this mark an any future designs or launches. Complimentary Limited-Edition PrintsJust as exclusive will be our complimentary limited edition commemorative prints. Every backer who pre-orders a watch will receive a free 11” x 17" (279.4mm x 431.8mm) print that highlights their watch and the spirit of the brand. The prints, which were inspired by the vintage travel ads of the early 20th century, will be printed on archival matte paper and will be individually numbered.And again, you can only get these special edition prints here and now. The Skylark Print is a play on our belief that good design speaks for itself and naturally gets noticed - something that we hope speaks true of the Skylark and all of our designs. The Ogden Print. The basic concept for this print came to me very early on. As a decades long rider of public transportation in my home city of Chicago IL, the subway car became my inspiration for this image of riders on the subway.You first notice a sea of hands, all with smart watches except for one hand featuring the Ogden. The watches were aligned in a way to make the Ogden stand out. It's meant to stand out, the watch was designed to look different than anything else.If you look closely at the ads along the top of the train car, you'll notice that they read: "They may be smart, but they don't have heart". This is a reference to that fact that while smart watches are trendy and can do a million things, there's still value and beauty in an invention that has done one thing, so elegantly, for over 500 years. And especially in the escapement mechanism that is its beating heart. Just because something is new doesn't mean that it's better. The Archer Print is meant to capture that feeling of getting away from the office on a beautiful Friday after work. The caption on the bottom emphasizes that there's more to life than work - something that I know a lot of us often lose sight of. Exclusive Campaign PricingBackers who preorder a watch will save up to $200 off of retail by taking advantage of our special campaign pricing.Please note: The Ogden and Archer models are stretch goals and will only be made available for preorder if our stretch goal targets are met.  PerksBackers who support our campaign can choose from a number of contribution options and perks.Pre-order a watchBackers who wish to pre-order a watch will receive a special edition, limited availability mechanical watch (only 300 “OP ‘21” watches of each design will ever be made) at a discount that is only available here and now.Additionally, backers who preorder a watch will receive a complimentary, 11" x 17" (279.4mm x 431.8mm) print featuring custom artwork highlighting their new watch.Please note: The Ogden and Archer models are stretch goals and will only be made available for preorder if our stretch goal targets are met.Store CreditsBackers can also select a store credit as a perk. story:
Lots of women with larger feet have trouble finding fashionable shoes which actually fit them. What they are left with is buying shoes in men department because it is the only place where they find shoes their size. NO women feel lady like in men’s shoes.


LLXLLQ came to the rescue for those women. We manufacture and sell handmade Italian shoes, all made from real leather or the best suede. We focus our attention and make exclusive size 10-12 shoes. They are specially designed for larger feet and provide an optical illusion of a much smaller foot.  They are really soft and wider than a regular women shoe is. That is why they offer support and comfort those women so desperately need. We also offer half sizes so the shoe always fits perfectly! Shoes are available in 10, 10.5, 11, 11.5 and 12. That is our speciality!

Now here is where you can step into the game and help those women. We aren’t yet a well-known brand, but we do have an excellent product which will help those women get comfortable and fashionable shoes they need. By donating you don't just get this lovely shoes, but you are also spreading the word and helping other women find beautiful shoes they deserve.


Our Collection:
HEELS


SANDALS

FLATS


Thanks for your support!

story:
The Coolector: "they have some mightily impressive specifications that showcases the fact that they are excellent watches first and foremost and their charitable actions merely compliments this."

Vouchmag: "Cloutier Nouvelle-France is doing much more than creating luxury watches, they're making exceptional timepieces with the added benefit of helping children in need."

Watchpaper: "By choosing the path of a social responsible business model, Cloutier is adding to the challenges, this is one more reason you should check out their project on Indiegogo and share it with your friends." 

Pretty Darn Cool: "Apart from trying to help better the worlds' water, the Cloutier Nouvelle-France watch is absolutely beautiful, with classic finishes and a minimalistic feel to it"

TechMASH UK: "Here is a cool way of getting your hands on a brilliant stylishly designed watch and help WaterAid provide clean safe drinking water..."

Master Horologer: "Cloutier Nouvelle-France, a new start up watch brand from Canada announces their debut collection of watches that carries a mission: Give clean water to a person in need."


Why use a Crowdfunding site for this project?

IndieGoGo allows us to raise the capital needed to deal directly with the best manufactures out there and to cut out the middle men (Distributors, brokers, retailers) providing you with a great quality watch at an affordable price and at the same time supporting a great cause with no risk on your part.


1) Cut out the middle men

2) Get a beautiful timepiece at a great price

3) Help make the world a better place

4) No Risk! -  Funders get their money back if campaign does not reach the 65,000$ goal 

 

Our Story   

Founded by a group of friends in Montreal, a city know for it's European flair and sophistication, Cloutier Nouvelle-France was conceived as an alternative startup challenging the status quo of the current business world.  

With a philanthropic emphasis as our backbone, we strongly believe that businesses have a bigger role to pay in this world than simply turning a profit.


While many people in our societies have prospered, too many people are still left behind.

Over 1 billion people on this earth are still living in extreme poverty. 

According to UNICEF 17,000 children die per day, mostly from preventable and treatable causes. 

For this reason we decided to combine our love of fashion, watches and social entrepreneurship, to offer elegantly crafted affordable timepieces with a greater purpose.

                                        

For our first project, we’ve decided to focus on one of our most basic needs, which most people take for granted, clean water.
Over 748 million people in the world do not have access to safe water. 

A child dies every 60 seconds from water-related diseases. Diarrhea, being one of these illnesses, is the second leading cause of death among children under five worldwide. 


Women and children spend 140 million hours a day collecting water for their families’ survival. This is time not working for income to support family nor going to school... Education being a vital part to the growth of all societies. 

Safe water is also considered a life blood of the Ebola treatment units and plays a huge part in preventing future outbreaks.


Cloutier Nouvelle-France strongly believes that every man, woman and child should have access to clean water, and with your help, is determined to help relieve this pain. 


To help us address this issue, we’ve partnered with Wateraid, a non-profit organization to ensure that for every watch purchased, the gift of clean water will be provided to someone in need. A gift that can change a life forever.


~"Is the rich world aware of how four billion of the six billion live? If we were aware, we would want to help out, we'd want to get involved" - Bill Gates~


By purchasing a Cloutier Nouvelle-France timepiece, not only will you be the proud owner of a beautiful unique vintage inspired swiss movement watch but will also be wearing a watch with a greater purpose and a story worth sharing. 

The Cloutier Nouvelle-France Collection


         La Classique:

Choose Your Case Colour: Rose Gold, Gold, or Stainless Steel

Your Choice of 40mm or 46mm:

Choose Clear Blue or Full Blue Hands:



Choose Your Strap Colour: Brown, Red, Black, or Blue  


         Le Chrono:


Your Choice of 40mm or 46mm:

Choose Clear Blue or Full Blue Hands:


Choose Your Strap Colour: Brown, Red, Black, or Blue :


Choose Your Case Colour: Rose Gold, Gold, or Stainless Steel:           




Customize your watch:

We will be sending out a survey at the conclusion of the Indiegogo campaign where you will indicate the details to customize your Cloutier Nouvelle-France:

1) Choose your strap colour - Red, blue, brown, or black

2) Choose you case colour - Gold, Rose Gold, or Stainless

3) Choose your hand style - Full Blue or Outline Blue

4) Choose your size - 40 mm or 46 mm

We will confirm your shipping address and other details. Shipping is free within the USA and Canada and offer competitive shipping for our international customers.  

Any questions, please contact: Info@cloutierwatches.com


The Design Process

Numerous months were taken to meticulously create a beautiful stylish, Swiss movement watch from design to production. By partnering directly with some of the leading timepiece manufacturers we're able to provide you with a beautiful vintage-inspired style at an affordable price. By offering yourself or a loved one the gift of a Cloutier Nouvelle-France watch you will directly impact the lives of those in need, giving them the gift of time in more ways than one.




How do we give? 



1. BUY
Customers purchase a Cloutier Nouvelle-France Watch.

2. GIVE
For every watch purchased Cloutier Nouvelle-France will provide 25$ to WaterAid. 
Just 25$ can give one person access to clean, safe drinking water. 
Your purchase can change one life forever.

3. BUILD
100% of funds go toward supporting specific WaterAid projects in sub-Saharan Africa.
WaterAid pools your gift with the gifts of others in order to meet the urgent need for clean water in a community or at a school, thereby helping hundreds or even thousands.

4. PRACTICAL
WaterAid uses practical, locally-appropriate and cost-effective technologies so to ensure that operational maintenance requirements for the new water supply and sanitation facilities can be easily learned and adopted by local community members.

5. SUSTAINABLE
All aspects of WaterAid’s projects are designed and implemented with long-term sustainability in mind. This means that upon completion of projects, community members are equipped with all the tools and knowledge required to manage and maintain their new facilities.

Can 25$ really provide water for life to someone in need?

There is a great deal of variation between projects due to considerations like country, region, access to markets, population to be served, type of water solution deemed to be locally appropriate etc.

$25 covers the one-off set-up cost of water. It does not cover any ongoing costs, which are absorbed by the community through cost recovery programs that WaterAid help them to set-up and through support from local water utilities/offices. WaterAid's objective is not to build dependency, but rather to provide the initial infrastructure and to help build local capacities and systems for ongoing operation and maintenance. 

                 

We need your Support!

In order to turn this vision into reality, we need your help!

Things you can do to help this project come to life:

1) Buy a Watch

2) Share this Story to a friend

3) Share the link to this site on Facebook 

4) Like our Facebook page

5) A simple tweet

Every little action counts! 

Thank you for being a part of this project!


Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge will be getting the word out.

We also realize that creating and delivering a product is a complicated process and often comes with unexpected challenges. That is why we have been preparing. 

Not only do we have two of our co-founders that have already been through the successful launch of two different watch projects on Crowdfounding sites.

But we have also spent the past several months making sure our supply chain is in check. We have well-established relationships with reliable watch manufacturers and strap makers. Our team has the experience and is prepared to deal with fulfillment of goods. We also have contingency plans for all the steps that are out of our control.

We are going to keep our backers informed during the production process as we believe effective communication is important. We'll do this with regular updates and sharing pictures as often as possible, for example when manufacturing of the watch cases is completed, during manufacturing of components, during final assembly, when the packaging is produced, etc…


If somewhere along the way we find that there is a setback in production, or that we cannot make the timeline, we will keep all of our backers informed.

Cloutier Nouvelle-France is a new breed of business and is here for the long-term.

Remember, for every watch you purchase, the gift of water is included in the price of the watch!

Support us by choosing your "Perks" 

Thank you

4) No Risk! -  Funders get their money back if campaign does not reach the 65,000$ goal 

 

Our Story   


Founded by a group of friends in Montreal, a city know for it's European flair and sophistication, Cloutier Nouvelle-France was conceived as an alternative startup challenging the status quo of the current business world.  






With a philanthropic emphasis as our backbone, we strongly believe that businesses have a bigger role to pay in this world than simply turning a profit.
While many people in our societies have prospered, too many people are still left behind.
Over 1 billion people on this earth are still living in extreme poverty. 
According to UNICEF 17,000 children die per day, mostly from preventable and treatable causes. 
For this reason we decided to combine our love of fashion, watches and social entrepreneurship, to offer elegantly crafted affordable timepieces with a greater purpose.


                                        

For our first project, we’ve decided to focus on one of our most basic needs, which most people take for granted, clean water.Over 748 million people in the world do not have access to safe water. 


A child dies every 60 seconds from water-related diseases. Diarrhea, being one of these illnesses, is the second leading cause of death among children under five worldwide. 


Women and children spend 140 million hours a day collecting water for their families’ survival. This is time not working for income to support family nor going to school... Education being a vital part to the growth of all societies. 


Safe water is also considered a life blood of the Ebola treatment units and plays a huge part in preventing future outbreaks.

Cloutier Nouvelle-France strongly believes that every man, woman and child should have access to clean water, and with your help, is determined to help relieve this pain. 

To help us address this issue, we’ve partnered with Wateraid, a non-profit organization to ensure that for every watch purchased, the gift of clean water will be provided to someone in need. A gift that can change a life forever.
~"Is the rich world aware of how four billion of the six billion live? If we were aware, we would want to help out, we'd want to get involved" - Bill Gates~
By purchasing a Cloutier Nouvelle-France timepiece, not only will you be the proud owner of a beautiful unique vintage inspired swiss movement watch but will also be wearing a watch with a greater purpose and a story worth sharing. 






The Cloutier Nouvelle-France Collection






         La Classique:



Choose Your Case Colour: Rose Gold, Gold, or Stainless Steel



Your Choice of 40mm or 46mm:



Choose Clear Blue or Full Blue Hands:



Choose Your Strap Colour: Brown, Red, Black, or Blue  


         Le Chrono:



Your Choice of 40mm or 46mm:








Choose Clear Blue or Full Blue Hands:



Choose Your Strap Colour: Brown, Red, Black, or Blue :

Choose Your Case Colour: Rose Gold, Gold, or Stainless Steel:           











Customize your watch:
We will be sending out a survey at the conclusion of the Indiegogo campaign where you will indicate the details to customize your Cloutier Nouvelle-France:

1) Choose your strap colour - Red, blue, brown, or black
2) Choose you case colour - Gold, Rose Gold, or Stainless
3) Choose your hand style - Full Blue or Outline Blue
4) Choose your size - 40 mm or 46 mm
We will confirm your shipping address and other details. Shipping is free within the USA and Canada and offer competitive shipping for our international customers.  
Any questions, please contact: Info@cloutierwatches.com

The Design Process


Numerous months were taken to meticulously create a beautiful stylish, Swiss movement watch from design to production. By partnering directly with some of the leading timepiece manufacturers we're able to provide you with a beautiful vintage-inspired style at an affordable price. By offering yourself or a loved one the gift of a Cloutier Nouvelle-France watch you will directly impact the lives of those in need, giving them the gift of time in more ways than one.














How do we give? 






1. BUYCustomers purchase a Cloutier Nouvelle-France Watch.2. GIVEFor every watch purchased Cloutier Nouvelle-France will provide 25$ to WaterAid. Just 25$ can give one person access to clean, safe drinking water. Your purchase can change one life forever.3. BUILD100% of funds go toward supporting specific WaterAid projects in sub-Saharan Africa.WaterAid pools your gift with the gifts of others in order to meet the urgent need for clean water in a community or at a school, thereby helping hundreds or even thousands.4. PRACTICALWaterAid uses practical, locally-appropriate and cost-effective technologies so to ensure that operational maintenance requirements for the new water supply and sanitation facilities can be easily learned and adopted by local community members.5. SUSTAINABLEAll aspects of WaterAid’s projects are designed and implemented with long-term sustainability in mind. This means that upon completion of projects, community members are equipped with all the tools and knowledge required to manage and maintain their new facilities.

Can 25$ really provide water for life to someone in need?There is a great deal of variation between projects due to considerations like country, region, access to markets, population to be served, type of water solution deemed to be locally appropriate etc.$25 covers the one-off set-up cost of water. It does not cover any ongoing costs, which are absorbed by the community through cost recovery programs that WaterAid help them to set-up and through support from local water utilities/offices. WaterAid's objective is not to build dependency, but rather to provide the initial infrastructure and to help build local capacities and systems for ongoing operation and maintenance. 




                 
We need your Support!

In order to turn this vision into reality, we need your help!
Things you can do to help this project come to life:
1) Buy a Watch
2) Share this Story to a friend
3) Share the link to this site on Facebook 
4) Like our Facebook page
5) A simple tweet
Every little action counts! 
Thank you for being a part of this project!


   
Risks & Challenges  
Our biggest challenge will be getting the word out.
We also realize that creating and delivering a product is a complicated process and often comes with unexpected challenges. That is why we have been preparing. 
Not only do we have two of our co-founders that have already been through the successful launch of two different watch projects on Crowdfounding sites.
But we have also spent the past several months making sure our supply chain is in check. We have well-established relationships with reliable watch manufacturers and strap makers. Our team has the experience and is prepared to deal with fulfillment of goods. We also have contingency plans for all the steps that are out of our control.
We are going to keep our backers informed during the production process as we believe effective communication is important. We'll do this with regular updates and sharing pictures as often as possible, for example when manufacturing of the watch cases is completed, during manufacturing of components, during final assembly, when the packaging is produced, etc…



If somewhere along the way we find that there is a setback in production, or that we cannot make the timeline, we will keep all of our backers informed.
Cloutier Nouvelle-France is a new breed of business and is here for the long-term.
Remember, for every watch you purchase, the gift of water is included in the price of the watch!
Support us by choosing your "Perks" 
Thank you

story:
buhel SG05s EVO 

The pioneer Buhel SoundGlasses powered by Bone Conduction that work without cutting off the world outside, with the cutting- edge bidirectional microphone is integrated into the bridge of the glasses, assuring a clear voice transmission are the perfect sport glasses

 

SG05S EVO you can make and receive calls via Bluetooth, listen to music without earbuds, activate SIRI, Cortana or Google Assistant with one touch of a button, and even communicate with GPS systems or other electronics, while maintaining the ability to hear 100% of the sound around you

 

                     

                                                       

           

THANKS TO THE NEW SILICON SUPPORT WE HAVE  REDUCED THE  SOUND DISPERSION AND THANKS TO THE NEW LINE OF TEMPLES SG05S  PERFECTLY FIT  WITH EVERY TYPE OF HELMETS

 

WE LOVE HELMETS

            

They're perfect for use while you drive, ride, ski, sail run or climb, and are compatible with almost any Bluetooth device, so you can increase safety, awareness and tech savvy in one sleek package

 

   

The cutting-edge bidirectional microphone is integrated into the bridge of the sunglasses, assuring that the transmission is clear and not disturbed by wind or other sounds.

                                     ANSI Z80.3:2010  -  EN ISO 12312-1-2013  -  AS/NZS 1067:2003 

 

                                                  

 

SG05s Field Test

                         

                                                                 SMOKE AND REVO LENS                                                                      

                                                    Quick lens change according to bright light                                                                                                                                                                                                                 

LENSES SPECS: All lenses are PC 2.0, Category 3 protection, Impact resistant and anti-scratch and they meet the following technical regulations 

USA: ANSI Z80.3:2001 Sunglasses and fashion spectacles
CE: EN ISO 12312-1:2013 
AUSTRALIA: AS/NZS 1067:2003 (A1:2009) Sunglasses and fashion spectacles

                             

          

RX - ADAPTOR FOR PRESCRIPTION LENS

 

ASIAN PERFECT FIT

SPECIAL NOSE PAD WITH MEMORY FIT TECH.

      

READY FOR YOU

          

       

TECH. INFO 

Bt 4.0, class 2, - 10mt  

Bt profile HSP 1.2, HFP 1.6, A2DP v1.2, AVRCP v1.4

BT Range is approx. 33 feet / 10 meters

Memory: SG05 remembers up to 7 different devices

Rechargeable battery Li-ion, 3.7V 150mAh

Charge time 2 hrs

Talk time 3 hrs (approx.)

Standby time 300 hrs (approx.)

Water Resistant, IP56 Certified

Weight 42g

Size 145x45x170mm

BCT (Bone Conduction Tech) SPEAKER

Number Of Speakers: 2

Type: Magnetic

Output impedance 8Ω ± 15% test @200Hz 3v

Frequency response 300Hz -10000Hz 

Output level 89±3dB

MICROPHONE

Type Electret Condenser 

Output impedance 2.2 K 

Frequency response 50Hz–10000Hz

Microphone sensitivity 42db ± 3dB at 1KHz (0dB 1V/Pa) 

Directivity Bi-directional – Noise canceling

Me! My Buhel EVO! My Smoke Lens!

Many people are trying to make products with bone conduction

But no one seems to be able to manage it yet.... only  pioneers are on it. 

Buhel Milano

BUHEL SG05s EVO - BOX

story:
The idea behind the britome app.

 

No matter what we’re looking for – we’ll find it on the internet at the best price! Anything?  What about the things you only get at a few stores worldwide and only instore because there are only a handful of pieces available ? You could, of course, try to get them via some auction platform for triple the price but wouldn’t it be much cooler  if you had a friend that lives around the corner of this shop, that simply gets the things for you? That would be great, I know, but what if you don´t know people that live in the city where the store is located? The idea I had was to build something like a dating platform but with the difference that on this platform,the users don´t fall in love with each other but do each other a favor by getting something for someone that is out of that person’s reach.

The idea of creating “britome” came to my mind while I was looking for a way to get the milk mag from Hong Kong (http://www.milk.com.hk), because I´m collecting a lot of exotic stuff about streetwear. But there is no way of getting this magazine, with the value of a few bucks, on the internet or in a store in Germany. The only way to get the mag is to travel to Hong Kong or to find a friend who travels to Hong Kong but the best way to get it, is to know someone in Hong Kong!!!

Just check out the video above to get an idea of the app!

 

Why I need your support and money!

 

I want to make the britome app more than a hobby and I want to work with people who give a 100% for this project. I‘ve worked with very talented people, who did their best to support me while having their regular job but it didn’t work out. I really want to create this app with experts in the background but if I ask for a 100% of their time, I need money to pay them.

 

Why I don’t get venture capital or something like that?

 

Trust me, I’ve tried it. The problem is that many VCs in Europe don´t want to invest in companies who are setting up something completely new and I think that’s the big difference between Europe and countries like the United States. But hey, if you’re a VC and are interested to invest in this campaign, you’re more than welcometo do so!

 

The Perks:

  • britome Book Perk

This is the "Book Perk" with all All Gone books from every year (without the very limited versions). All of them was very hard to get!

  • britome UK Perk

This is the "UK Perk" with a collection of Banksy Stuff. Highlights are the Time Out issue with poster and the hard to get Swiddle mag.

  • britome XX Perk

This is the "XX Perk" with a collection of KAWS stuff. Higlights are the Book Kaws One and the limited editions of I.D., complex (both covers) and Arkitip including the incase bag.

  • britome Classic Perk

This is the "Classic Perk" with a Nike Air Classic BW from Nike and Stash (Size 10). The shoes are already worn but in a good condition. The box are signed by Stash himself.

  • britome Inflate Perk

This is the "Inflate Perk" with a Solebox x Reebok Pump 20th Anniversary Edition (16 of 29 in Size 10.5 US) including sneaker freaker 17 and a poster with all versions of the 20th Anniversary Pumps.

  • britome Transformation Perk

This is the "Transformation Perk" with a special Nike Air Force III in the colors of the movie (Size 10.5 US).

  • britome Mouse Perk

This is the "Mouse Perk" with a limited edition vinyl toy from David Flores.

  • britome Iron perk

This is the "Iron Perk" with a limited edition Iron Man from hot toys.hk (Mark V).

  • britome Graffiti Perk

This is the "Graffiti Perk" with a book from Saber. The book is signed by himself.

  • britome Bikini perk

This is the "Bikini Perk" with 2 very rare Sports Illustrated Bikini Editions in german language.

 

The Team:

 

Marco Tiedeke 

 

I’m a 34 year old male, based in Hamburg, Germany. I’m currently working for an IT Company and I’m completely addicted to technology, streetwear, sneakers and all kinds of exotic stuff. Since the start of the internet as we know it, I have been dreaming about building my own startup but I didn’t have the right idea ... until now!

 

Ubilabs

 

My technical co-founder will be Ubilabs, who are also based in Hamburg, Germany. They’ve started their business in 2007 and currently have 16 employees, who are helping me to create the best app on the planet. Their team consists of developers, architects, marketing experts and, of course, designers who have been working in this business for many years. The reason to choose Ubilabs for this project is simple the fact that they’re specialized in providing location-based services. Please visit Ubilab’s site (http://www.ubilabs.net) and check out „Projekte“ to see some of their current projects.

Since the start of the internet as we know it, I have been dreaming about building my own startup but I didn’t have the right idea ... until now!
 
Ubilabs
 
My technical co-founder will be Ubilabs, who are also based in Hamburg, Germany. They’ve started their business in 2007 and currently have 16 employees, who are helping me to create the best app on the planet. Their team consists of developers, architects, marketing experts and, of course, designers who have been working in this business for many years. The reason to choose Ubilabs for this project is simple the fact that they’re specialized in providing location-based services. Please visit Ubilab’s site (http://www.ubilabs.net) and check out „Projekte“ to see some of their current projects.

story:
About Flâneur Louis 

The name Flâneur Louis is originated from 19th century France. Flâneur is derived from a French verb “flâner” which means "to stroll”, it is an important symbol for scholars, artists and writers.

At Flâneur Louis it is our philosophy to return the quality of time spent. Our artistic timepieces are designed to encourage a thoughtful, meaningful, and intellectual lifestyle. They are a true gastronomy of the eye. 

Design Elements

The two timepieces in our first series are the Saunterer and the Boulevard. Both feature our signature stylistic elements.

  • The balanced and curved watch hand, which is inspired by a gentleman’s tailcoat
  • The thoughtful and artful design of everything from the font, scale, and most precise of details.
  • Saunterer features our signature single-hand, which extends into an artful wisp and a bold, yet elegant face, which measures time in 5 minute intervals

Specifications

  • Dimensions: 43mm Case, 50mm lug to lug
  • 316L Stainless Steel Case
  • Sapphire Crystal
  • Screw down crown
  • Miyota 8N24 Automatic Movement (Japanese)
  • 10 ATM Water Resistant
  • Super Luminova Hands and Dial (for Boulevard only)

The case for all Flâneur Louis watches are made of high grade 316L stainless steel and sapphire crystal glass with 10 ATM water resistant.

The caseback is engraved with the text "316L stainless steel, 10 ATM, sapphire glass " and our logo. The caseback also features a sapphire glass that displays the beautiful Miyota movement. 

A screw-down crown is used to ensures water-resistance.

Single Hand Watch

As a tools of measurement, the single-hand watch represents an unorthodox approach to time telling. But in the old age before precise clocks and watches were invented, time were measured vaguely. We are seldom aware of how the experience of life was changed due to the different perception of time. Going back to the very basic with a single hand watch, by perceiving time in a larger interval, users will have an experience as if the time has slowed down.

Although the single-hand watch is designed to display the approximate time at the first glance, we maintain its ability to tell time precisely by adding scale that is specifically designed for single-hand watch on the dial.

Every hour is separated into 4 section, each section represents a 15-minute interval, with the number marking of 15,30 and 45, every section is divided into three sub-sections representing 5-minute intervals.

The Founder and The Process

Flâneur Louis was founded by a watch enthusiast Louis Ng, who was born in the 1980s in Hong Kong. He discovered his passion in watches, art and design in his early school years. He chose to study economic in college and pursued a career in the financial industry. Having worked in a harsh, stressed and tiring working environment for years, he realized the importance of the quality of time spent to one’s life, so, he decided, in 2014, to follow his passion and found Flâneur Louis with a mission to encourage individuals to live in the moment and value every second in their life.

The first step of the design process was to create the 2D drawing of the concept. I then approached many manufacturers with my designs. 


I was then provided with technical drawings and the process of production began.

Timeline

Early November 2014     :  End of Indiegogo campaign and Production run begins.

Early January 2015          :  QC of watches  

Mid February 2015           :  Delivery to Customer!!


Choose Your Reward

The fund raised will be used to finance the first production run of Flâneur Louis watches and packaging materials.  

Please find more information regarding the different perk rewards below:

$5 : Thank you!

Welcome to the Flâneur Louis family, thank you very much!

$280: Early Bird Special

A piece of Saunterer or Boulevard will be rewarded If you pledge USD 280 at the early bird stage, limited to 25 pieces for each model.

$350: Pre-order Special

Receive a piece of Saunterer or Boulevard at pre-order price.
$550: The Flâneur Louis Collection
Receive both Saunterer and Boulevard at a discounted price.
