About Flâneur Louis 
The name Flâneur Louis is originated from 19th century France. Flâneur is derived from a French verb “flâner” which means "to stroll”, it is an important symbol for scholars, artists and writers.
At Flâneur Louis it is our philosophy to return the quality of time spent. Our artistic timepieces are designed to encourage a thoughtful, meaningful, and intellectual lifestyle. They are a true gastronomy of the eye. 
Design Elements
The two timepieces in our first series are the Saunterer and the Boulevard. Both feature our signature stylistic elements.

The balanced and curved watch hand, which is inspired by a gentleman’s tailcoat
The thoughtful and artful design of everything from the font, scale, and most precise of details.

Saunterer features our signature single-hand, which extends into an artful wisp and a bold, yet elegant face, which measures time in 5 minute intervals




Specifications



Dimensions: 43mm Case, 50mm lug to lug
316L Stainless Steel Case
Sapphire Crystal
Screw down crown
Miyota 8N24 Automatic Movement (Japanese)
10 ATM Water Resistant
Super Luminova Hands and Dial (for Boulevard only)






The case for all Flâneur Louis watches are made of high grade 316L stainless steel and sapphire crystal glass with 10 ATM water resistant.

The caseback is engraved with the text "316L stainless steel, 10 ATM, sapphire glass " and our logo. The caseback also features a sapphire glass that displays the beautiful Miyota movement. 

A screw-down crown is used to ensures water-resistance.
Single Hand Watch
As a tools of measurement, the single-hand watch represents an unorthodox approach to time telling. But in the old age before precise clocks and watches were invented, time were measured vaguely. We are seldom aware of how the experience of life was changed due to the different perception of time. Going back to the very basic with a single hand watch, by perceiving time in a larger interval, users will have an experience as if the time has slowed down.
Although the single-hand watch is designed to display the approximate time at the first glance, we maintain its ability to tell time precisely by adding scale that is specifically designed for single-hand watch on the dial.

Every hour is separated into 4 section, each section represents a 15-minute interval, with the number marking of 15,30 and 45, every section is divided into three sub-sections representing 5-minute intervals.

The Founder and The Process


Flâneur Louis was founded by a watch enthusiast Louis Ng, who was born in the 1980s in Hong Kong. He discovered his passion in watches, art and design in his early school years. He chose to study economic in college and pursued a career in the financial industry. Having worked in a harsh, stressed and tiring working environment for years, he realized the importance of the quality of time spent to one’s life, so, he decided, in 2014, to follow his passion and found Flâneur Louis with a mission to encourage individuals to live in the moment and value every second in their life.


The first
step of the design process was to create the 2D drawing of the concept. I then approached many manufacturers with my designs. 

I was then provided with technical drawings and the process of production began.
Timeline
Early November 2014     :  End of Indiegogo campaign and Production run begins.
Early January 2015          :  QC of watches  
Mid February 2015           :  Delivery to Customer!!

Choose Your Reward

The fund raised will
be used to
finance the first production run of Flâneur Louis watches and packaging
materials.  
Please find more information regarding the different perk rewards below:

$5 : Thank you!
Welcome to the Flâneur Louis family, thank you very much!
$280: Early Bird Special
A piece of Saunterer or Boulevard will be rewarded If you pledge USD 280 at the early bird stage, limited to 25 pieces for each model.
$350: Pre-order Special
Receive a piece of Saunterer or Boulevard at pre-order price.$550: The Flâneur Louis CollectionReceive both Saunterer and Boulevard at a discounted price.

story:
We are Kanna Wear; a lifestyle accessories brand that provides stylish goods for the modern day explorer. The name Kanna means explore in Icelandic and it’s an idea that truly epitomizes the spirit of the brand. Whether it’s a mountain we’ve never skied, a band we’ve never heard, or a country we’ve never been to, Kanna explorers always try to take advantage of life’s unexpected opportunities. 

We've been around since 2014, making some of the finest wooden watches on the market and now we are looking to add a new style to our watch line with a little bit of your help.




We love wood watches, but don't always enjoy the look because they can be bulky and awkward due to the limitations of making the case from wood. Lucky for you we recognized this and decided we could make a better watch. 

The Denver is pretty much the best looking and most comfortable wood watch on the market with an incredible 2mm bezel, which for a wood watch is incredibly thin.

The immaculate and damn near indestructible hardened Sapphire Crystal face runs practically off the edge like an infinity pool giving the Denver a very unique look. Most wood watches come with an easily scratch-able mineral glass, but we said to hell with that and tacked on a sapphire crystal just cause we can. Most watch companies charge over $150 for watches with sapphire crystals, but not us.

The black dial face is accented with matching black stainless steel crown, back plate, and pinch release clasp making it super easy to take on and off. The steel back plate eliminates the common issue of cracking. And behind that steel plate is a Japanese Quartz Miyota 2035 movement, one of the most reliable and accurate movements out there.






Eco-friendly, Lightweight, & Durable

Bamboo is one of the most useful materials on earth and can be used to make just about anything! It's technically not a wood, but actually a grass which means it grows at much faster rate than it's hardwood counterparts. On top of that when bamboo is harvested it's cut at the stalk and then just starts regrowing again, unlike hardwood trees which need to be replanted and take between 30-50 years to grow to maturity. Bamboo truly is a renewable resource!

The first thing you'll notice when you pick up the Denver is how light it is. As soon as you wrap it around your wrist you'll forget it's even on (until someone compliments it that is). Weighing in at under 50g, it's one of the lightest watches on the market.

Not only is it amazingly light, but bamboo is incredibly durable. It's stronger than oak and is considered one of the most durable hardwoods, and unlike many hardwoods bamboo resists swelling so the watch will retain its shape.

So if you couldn't tell, we really like bamboo!




It's pretty simple, we have a rad bamboo watch, and we want you to help us make it. In order to have this watch produced we have to hit certain minimums with our factory and we believe crowdfunding is the best way to do it.

Rather than getting a loan to purchase inventory and paying interest to those dirty no-good swindling bankers, we would rather raise the funds by offering a pre-sale of the Denver at an awesomely low price to you!

So here's how it works:

  • The first 80 backers are the real MVP's. You will be able to purchase the Denver for only $45! These initial contributions will get the ball rolling for us.
  • The next two tiers are 150 watches available at $55, and 200 watches available at $65.
  • We then use the funds from these three tiers to place an order with our factory
  • Lastly, if we don't hit our goal of $9,000 then we don't make the watches, simple as that.
  • Our campaign is limited to a total of 430 watches to ensure prompt delivery, allow sufficient attention to detail and quality, and maintain a level of exclusivity.
So share the crap out of this campaign because the quicker we reach our goal the sooner we can start production and the sooner you can start wearing your Kanna watch!



We can't make this awesome wrist candy without your help. In order to make this idea into a reality we need to raise enough to hit our factory minimum and we believe Indiegogo is the perfect platform to do just that. So here are some reasons why we think you should back the Denver:

  • You can be confident knowing that we are an already established brand with a history of quality products.
  • Our relationship and history with our manufacturer makes for very few surprises and confidence in the quality and timeliness of delivery.
  • Plain and simple; this watch is dope and is sure to be a conversation starter.



As we've mentioned before wood watches are sort of our thing. But like anything, unexpected events can happen though we believe we have prepared ourselves to handle anything that comes our way by taking the following steps:

  • Limiting the number of watches that we offer on pre-sale allows us to set more accurate and quicker delivery dates and gives us time to ensure each watch is inspected for quality and craftsmanship.
  • Having an established relationship with our manufacturer gives us confidence in their quality and ability to hit deadlines.
  • We've lined up an established drop shipper in ShipWire to handle all shipping meaning professional packaging, handling and tracking for your order

Timeline

Lucky for you everything has been designed, prototyped, tested and is ready for production so all we need is the capital to place the PO! Basically as soon as we hit our goal of $9,000 we can start production. It will take approximately 30 days to produce the watches, then we're budgeting for 15 days for handling, packaging, and delivering to you!

Right now to be safe we are saying early June delivery, but that's assuming we take all 30 days to raise the target amount and allowing for two weeks of unforeseen delays. We believe this would be the latest delivery date, but if we can hit the target early then we can get a head start on production and have them delivered in early May! So the more you help us get the word out, the quicker you'll get your watch!




One of the most important things about this specific Indiegogo is that if we don't hit our goal of $9,000, then we don't make the watches. It's that simple. A lot of Indiegogo campaigns will take your money regardless of if they hit their target, but not us. We want to make sure these watches are as good as they can be and we need to hit our target to do it.

So help us out and share the crap out of this campaign! Click one of the links on the left and make sure that your Denver watch gets made!



Is the Denver unisex?
Absolutely! The Denver is the perfect size for men and women alike. The band is easily adjustable so it can be sized to any wrist.

What are my shipping options?
In order to keep things simple and ensure we hit our delivery goals we are only shipping to the US, Canada, Europe, and Australia. The Denver will be available to ship worldwide after the crowdfunding period is over. Shipping cost will be determined at checkout depending on your address.

Who pays the customs fees on international shipments?
Unfortunately we can't cover the cost of duties and taxes. You will be responsible for paying all duties. It can take up to 4 weeks to receive your order depending on the destination and the time it takes to clear customs so some patience may be required. Usually customs will contact you to pay duties so make sure you provide accurate contact information so that they can reach you! (i.e. phone number, email, etc.)

Is there a warranty on my watch?
Absolutely! Your watch comes with a 12 month limited warranty. See the details on our Warranty page.

Is this watch waterproof?
This watch is NOT waterproof. Bamboo is a living plant, which means it has pores. We could seal those pores up with a sealant, but that would negate all the awesome hypoallergenic properties that make bamboo so awesome. That being said the Denver can handle a little bit of water (we call it splashproof), but we do not recommend exposing it to excessive water or submerging it. The band and case can some moisture and will just swell slightly when exposed to moisture. But don't worry this swelling will go away eventually once the wood dries out. Unfortunately we can't cover water damage under the limited warranty, but let us know if you have issues and we can find a solution for you.

How do I change the battery?
We recommend taking your watch to a jeweler or watch repair shop to have them change the battery as to avoid damaging the watch and voiding your warranty, but if you want to do it yourself simply remove the four screws on the back plate of the watch and inside you will be able to access the battery. 

ALLERGY DISCLAIMER 
Please note that The Denver is made from 100% bamboo. An allergic reaction to bamboo is very rare, but it can happen. We recommend that you monitor your skin to make sure you don't have any issues wearing bamboo (most don't). Note also that the clasp is stainless steel for those who have metal allergies. In the slim chance that you begin to experience any discomfort on your wrist, please stop wearing the watch immediately and consult your doctor. Kanna disclaims all responsibility for any resulting damages, injuries or expenses related to causes created by wearing a Kanna watch.

story:
It started with making a truly compelling design. Something that would make your wrist stand out. A design that would be as outstanding today as it will be in decades from now. The inspiration came from California, where vibrant colors are combined with boldness. The name Yosemite was inspired by Yosemite Valley, with its carved solid granite, creating spectacular rock formations.

It is very important for us to only use the highest grade materials. But we also realized early on that we had to partner up with a Swiss manufacturer, if we wanted superior quality.

After an extensive search, we found the perfect match. A Swiss factory that would not only partner up with us, but also had comprehensive previous experience in assembling and regulating the specific movements we’re using.

For the heart of the watch, the movement, we decided to partner up with the Swiss watch movement manufacturer Sellita that has been making movements since the nineteen fifties. Sellita is based in La-Chaux-de-Fonds, which is considered to be the Swiss watch making industry centre. We chose Sellita because of their proven track record of accuracy and robustness throughout the years. Their movements are also very easy to service, which made our decision even easier.

Sellita SW200-1:
• Self-winding (automatic)
• 26 jewels
• 28 800 vibrations per hour 
• Power reserve of 38 hours

Besides using the finest materials and working with industry leading suppliers and manufacturing partners, we guarantee the quality of our products by complying with high dimensional, technical and aesthetic parameters. Comprehensive test procedures to the different watch components are implemented throughout the manufacturing process. The quality control includes hundreds of different control points. Some of these are entry controls, water-resistance test, condensation test, airtightness test, automatic winding test, calendar operation test, power reserve test, 48h running test and craftsmanship of parts verifications.

An optical magnifying camera is used to guarantee the excellence of all external components. Before the watches are shipped out to you, a final aesthetic and functional control is carried out.

Six screws exhibition caseback

Six screws are used in order to secure the caseback. We did not settle with having a mineral glass caseback, but rather used thick sapphire crystal. This means that the exhibition display also will be scratch resistant. Through the back sapphire glass, you will be able to see the beautiful inner mechanics of the movement together with the rotor, featuring custom numbered edition engraving.

First Edition and Swiss Made is solidly engraved into the top and bottom part of the caseback, while leaving rest of the caseback space simply polished, for a refined look. 

316L Stainless Steel

We used fine 316L Stainless Steel for the case of our watch, as it’s known for its robustness, resistance to corrosion and staining, and low maintenance. Different steel polishing and brushing techniques are used to the different parts of the case, for a fully sophisticated look. The case is then plated by carefully applying a multi-layered PVD coating.

Diamond Cut & SuperLuminova

Both our indexes and hands are diamond cut in order to achieve the finest sharp shape. We work with hands and index makers that have been manufacturing them for decades.

In order to increase readability and appearance in low-light conditions, we decided to apply C3 SuperLuminova to the hour and minute hand. Due to the elegant indexes, we chose to keep them lume-free.

Sapphire Crystal (2x inner AR coating)

What would a high-quality watch be without its outer protection? Sapphire crystal is ranking 9/10 on the MOHS Scale Of Hardness, which is as close to indestructible as you can get. 

We wanted to provide glass that wouldn’t scratch. But we also wanted the glass to bring as little reflections as possible in order to add depth to the dial. As many of you may know, when adding an anti-reflective (AR) coating on the outside of the sapphire glass, it may easily be scratched, even if sapphire crystal is used underneath the coating. We solved this problem by putting a double layer AR-coating on the underside of the sapphire crystal. This results in a scratch proof glass, with less reflections.

Full-grain Italian calf leather straps (Calf, Suede and Alligator texture) with quick-release

Our leather straps feature the finest Italian full-grain calf leather with different textures. In order for them to be easily interchangeable, we chose to include quick-release spring bars in all of our leather straps.

With minds full of curiosity about leather and its manufacturing process, we set out on a mission to find the finest full grain leather, which took us on a journey through many different tanneries. We knew we had found the right one when we came across a wonderful tannery in Tuscany, Italy. The tannery has been tanning leather for decades and had passed the tannery down through generations. The leather is not only durable, but also very soft and comfortable to wear, which was an extremely important aspect for us. All the leather straps are made by soft calf leather with different textures, and are made by hand in Italy by passionated master artisans.

Different leather types:

Full-grain leather: Actually, there is nothing fancy or complicated about full-grain leather. It’s just the most natural form of leather, and that’s what we love about it. It is the least commonly used form of leather, because of its high price. Full-grain leather is the strongest and most durable part of the hide (skin), and it’s located just underneath the hair. Due to its tightness, it is very strong, but also very resistant to moisture. This is very important, especially when it comes to watch leather straps. Over time, full-grain leather also develops a gorgeous patina, which means that the leather straps will keep and develop their luster over time.

Top-grain leather: Top-grain leather is very similar to full-grain leather. The difference is that the top layer is thinned down by a couple of millimeters. With the top layer sanded and buffed away, a lot of imperfections disappear and the leather becomes much more smooth. However, when removing the most tight top layer of the leather, it becomes less durable and breaks down faster. This is a commonly used leather type that features good quality, but it lacks top strength and durability, and can sometimes also have a generic appearance.

Genuine leather: Genuine leather is the most popular leather used, at least for leather strap manufacturing. Not because of the quality, but rather because of its cheap price. It is made of an artificial grain that is applied to its surface. In order to increase the natural appearance of the leather, patterns are embossed into the surface and then sprayed with dyes or stain. 

Stainless Steel Butterfly Buckle

The leather strap features a butterfly buckle made of 316L Stainless Steel that opens with a light finger pressure. The advantage of a butterfly buckle is not solely that it looks great, but also that it’s very comfortable to wear as it forms the strap into a ring shape. This also avoids bending of the strap.

All of our straps will come with a separate butterfly buckle, even if you decide to purchase extra straps with your pledge.

 



 

Risks and challenges:
We have not only found very professional suppliers and partners, we have also developed a great relationship with them - which we believe is of tremendous importance when quality and schedule is a priority.

There is always a risk that our different suppliers will not fulfill component orders on time. However, we have worked with most of the suppliers and partners previously with no problems whatsoever. Our partnership is very organized and we are working closely with them through all phases of the manufacturing and will push hard to deliver before the actual set delivery dates. We will constantly keep you in the loop and if there would be any kinds of delays, we would let you know immediately.

Duty/VAT charges: All orders will be shipped out of Stockholm, Sweden or Lugano, Switzerland. We will cover all duty/VAT charges for all countries of the European Union (EU). If you live outside of EU, you will be responsible for any potential charges that might occur from your local authorities. We will however do our best to minimize any potential charges.

All orders will be shipped out securely using different express carriers with trackable shipments. Depending on country, various carriers will be used in order to make the shipment as seamless as possible for you.

Full-grain Italian calf leather straps (Calf, Suede and Alligator texture) with quick-release
Our leather straps feature the finest Italian full-grain calf leather with different textures. In order for them to be easily interchangeable, we chose to include quick-release spring bars in all of our leather straps.With minds full of curiosity about leather and its manufacturing process, we set out on a mission to find the finest full grain leather, which took us on a journey through many different tanneries. We knew we had found the right one when we came across a wonderful tannery in Tuscany, Italy. The tannery has been tanning leather for decades and had passed the tannery down through generations. The leather is not only durable, but also very soft and comfortable to wear, which was an extremely important aspect for us. All the leather straps are made by soft calf leather with different textures, and are made by hand in Italy by passionated master artisans.
Different leather types:
Full-grain leather: Actually, there is nothing fancy or complicated about full-grain leather. It’s just the most natural form of leather, and that’s what we love about it. It is the least commonly used form of leather, because of its high price. Full-grain leather is the strongest and most durable part of the hide (skin), and it’s located just underneath the hair. Due to its tightness, it is very strong, but also very resistant to moisture. This is very important, especially when it comes to watch leather straps. Over time, full-grain leather also develops a gorgeous patina, which means that the leather straps will keep and develop their luster over time.
Top-grain leather: Top-grain leather is very similar to full-grain leather. The difference is that the top layer is thinned down by a couple of millimeters. With the top layer sanded and buffed away, a lot of imperfections disappear and the leather becomes much more smooth. However, when removing the most tight top layer of the leather, it becomes less durable and breaks down faster. This is a commonly used leather type that features good quality, but it lacks top strength and durability, and can sometimes also have a generic appearance.
Genuine leather: Genuine leather is the most popular leather used, at least for leather strap manufacturing. Not because of the quality, but rather because of its cheap price. It is made of an artificial grain that is applied to its surface. In order to increase the natural appearance of the leather, patterns are embossed into the surface and then sprayed with dyes or stain. 

Stainless Steel Butterfly Buckle
The leather strap features a butterfly buckle made of 316L Stainless Steel that opens with a light finger pressure. The advantage of a butterfly buckle is not solely that it looks great, but also that it’s very comfortable to wear as it forms the strap into a ring shape. This also avoids bending of the strap.
All of our straps will come with a separate butterfly buckle, even if you decide to purchase extra straps with your pledge.


 
 Risks and challenges:We have not only found very professional suppliers and partners, we have also developed a great relationship with them - which we believe is of tremendous importance when quality and schedule is a priority.There is always a risk that our different suppliers will not fulfill component orders on time. However, we have worked with most of the suppliers and partners previously with no problems whatsoever. Our partnership is very organized and we are working closely with them through all phases of the manufacturing and will push hard to deliver before the actual set delivery dates. We will constantly keep you in the loop and if there would be any kinds of delays, we would let you know immediately.Duty/VAT charges: All orders will be shipped out of Stockholm, Sweden or Lugano, Switzerland. We will cover all duty/VAT charges for all countries of the European Union (EU). If you live outside of EU, you will be responsible for any potential charges that might occur from your local authorities. We will however do our best to minimize any potential charges.All orders will be shipped out securely using different express carriers with trackable shipments. Depending on country, various carriers will be used in order to make the shipment as seamless as possible for you.

story:
Comfort+Style

  • We believe a woman should be comfortable and feel sexy at the same time.
  • Simplebra is adaptable and versatile, perfect for every occasion.
  • Be part of the wirefree revolution!

Support us (no pun intended)

  • We're raising funds to cover the cost of our first production run.
  • You will get a unique SimpleBra for your contribution.
  • If the campaign doesn't succeed, we'll continue to sell them on our website for the full retail price.

The Impact

  • Help more women feel comfortable without compromising on style.
  • We have several very happy customers with repeat purchases.
  • It's gotta fit right. Free shipping and free returns.
